On 13 May 2020, the military forces of Mozambique attacked Islamist militants on a road that connects Chinda (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) to Mbauand and reportedly killed 42 militants.
Around 13 May 2020 (as reported), over 300 people were who displaced due to armed attacks in Cabo Delgado took refuge in the village of Namialo (Muecate, Nampula).
On 14 May 2020, members of an Islamist militia destroyed communication's towers in Ntotoe (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado).
On 14 May 2020, military forces of Mozambique attacked Islamist militants in Quissanga (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado) and reportedly killed 8 militants.
On 15 May 2020, a Mozambican businessman was abducted in the city of Beira (Beira, Sofala) by unknown armed people.

On 16 May 2020, local residents staged a demonstration in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado) against attacks and beatings by police for not wearing face masks in response to coronavirus. Police shot in the air to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]
On 17 May 2020, residents of 30 de Junho and Nanduadua neighbourhoods near Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) fled their homes aftern a group of unknown men were seen in the area.
On 17 May 2020, Islamist militants attacked Milangalewa village (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado), beheaded 10 men and forced a number of men to join the group.

On 17 May 2020, one person was killed and 3 were seriously injured in an ambush against 3 buses in the Nhamatanda district (Nhamatanda, Sofala). The attack was suspected to have been committed by the Renamo Military Junta.
On 20 May 2020, members of the FDS forces regained control of a base controlled by members of an Islamist militia in Catembe (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 20 May 2020, Islamist militants attacked Messumero village (Mahate, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities were reported.
Around 20 May 2020 (as reported), helicopters fired ground targets near Litamanda and Xitaxi (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado). The bodies of two assumed militants were discovered, split between 2 events.
On 20 May 2020, Islamist militants burned homes and a gas station in Namirumo (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities were reported.
Around 20 May 2020 (as reported), helicopters fired at ground targets near Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) and Xitaxi. The bodies of two assumed militants were discovered, split between 2 events.

Around 21 May 2020 (as reported), FDS forces, supported by DAG forces, clashed with an Islamist militia near Messumero (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). According to governmental reports, the base was taken over, something which other sources failed to confirm. No injuries and/or fatalities reported.
On 22 May 2020, suspected Islamist militants abducted 4 girls from Milamba neighbourhood, in the municipal town of Mocimboa da Praia (Cabo Delgado).
On 24 May 2020, members of an Islamist militia raided food from Koko village (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado).
On 24 May 2020, a civilian was killed by soldiers in Nanduadua (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado). Reason for the killing is unknown.

On 25 May 2020, about 200 people tried to vandalize a police post in Lichinga (Niassa) after authorities banned the celebration of the end of Ramadan at a local mosque due to restrictions of the state of emergency due to the coronavirus. Police opened fire and 2 people were killed. [size=about 200]

On 28 May 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with members of the FDS forces, supported by DAG forces, during an attack in Chai (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Several properties and houses were destroyed. 6 bodies were found by residents as they returned to the village.

On 28 May 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with members of the FDS forces, supported by DAG, during an attack on Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Several properties and houses were destroyed. 11 people were killed during the 3-day attack (28 May to 30 May). 11 fatalities split between 3 events.

On 28 May 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with members of the FDS forces, with support of the DAG, during an attack in Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Before the arrival of the security forces, the group gained control of the city for a short amount of time, with banks and governmental properties looted and destroyed. Several bombardment raids conducted by the helicopter gunships were reported, killing several civilians. According to reports, between 19 to 22 bodies were counted, including 5 members of the Rapid Intervention Unit and children who died of hunger or thirst. 19 fatalities split between 3 events.

column16: Lusa; Carta de Mocambique; Cabo Ligado
column17: On 28 May 2020, Islamist militants attacked Macomia Sede near Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) and destroyed various properties and houses. The military arrived at the scene. No fatalities reported.
On 29 May 2020, Islamist militants attacked Nova Zambezia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The military arrived at the scene. No fatalities reported.

On 29 May 2020, helicopter gunships of the Dyck Advisory Group and the FDS forces of Mozambique responded with airstrikes to the attacks of members of an Islamist militia in Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) from 28 May to 30 May. According to reports, between 19 to 22 bodies were counted, including 5 members of the Rapid Intervention Unit and children who died of hunger or thirst. 19 fatalities split between 3 events.

On 29 May 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Several properties and houses were destroyed. 11 people were killed during the 3-day attack, which started on 28 May 2020. 11 fatalities split between 3 events.

On 30 May 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Several properties and houses were destroyed. 11 people were killed during the 3-day attack, which started on 28 May 2020. 11 fatalities split between 3 events.

On 30 May 2020, helicopter gunships of the Dyck Advisory Group and the FDS forces of Mozambique responded with airstrikes to the attacks of members of an Islamist militia in Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) from 28 May to 30 May. According to reports, between 19 to 22 bodies were counted, including 5 members of the Rapid Intervention Unit and children who died of hunger or thirst. 19 fatalities split between 3 events.

On 31 May 2020, FDS forces, with support of the DAG, reportedly took back control of Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Government sources claimed that 78 members of an Islamist militia were killed, however this could not be corroborated and no bodies were located.
On 1 June 2020, about 250 displaced civilians from Macomia arrived in Pemba (Pemba, Cabo Delgado) after members of an Islamist militia occupied the city between 28 and 31 May 2020 (coded separately).
On 2 June 2020, suspected Islamist militants reportedly attacked the village of Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities were reported.

Around 2 June 2020 (as reported), residents found 6 dead bodies in Chai (Macomia), suspected to have been shot dead by Islamist militants during the attacks that occurred a few days before the findings.

On 3 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked displaced civilians in the ADPP junction, 19 de Outubro village (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). A beheaded body was later found in Meluco crossing, just south of the ADPP junction.
Around 3 June 2020 (week of), Islamist militants attacked Novo Zambezia (Macomia). Fatalities reported. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 3 June 2020, Islamist militants killed 17 people in Ilala (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The victims were in the village after running away from an attack in the city of Macomia.
On 3 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia beheaded 5 residents of Imbada (Meluco, Cabo Delgado). The group also raided the village.
On 4 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked Meluco (Meluco) and killed at least 3 people.
On 5 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed two fishermen (one was beheaded) at a beach close to Ulo (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado).

On 5 June 2020, Islamist militants abducted girls in the Nabubussi neighborhood of Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) as they drew water from a local well. According to sources, 10 girls were kidnapped.

On 9 June 2020, members of the FDS forces, with air support from DAG, destroyed the base of an Islamist militia in Marere (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The government forces recovered two armored cars and several weapons, while the militiamen fled the area and were seen in several neighborhoods of Mocimboa da Praia and other district villages, and briefly set up roadblocks. No injuries and/or fatalities were reported.
On 9 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 9 civilians in Ingoane (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).
On 9 June 2020, Islamist militants burned houses in Tororo (Quissanga).

On 9 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia abducted 3 women in Mpanga village (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) as the group moved north after an armed clash with the FDS forces in Nahere (coded separately).
On 9 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia beheaded 11 people and abducted 7 girls in Natugo 2 (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) and Mitacata. Fatalities split between two locations.
On 9 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia burned houses near Ingoane (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).
On 9 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia beheaded 11 people and abducted 7 girls in Natugo 2 and Mitacata (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Fatalities split between two locations.
On 9 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 6 people in Nacutuco (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).

On 9 June 2020, the combined air and ground offensive of the Mozambique military attacked Islamist militants in Mocimboa Da Praia (Cabo Delgado) and killed 22 militants. Two soldiers from the military were also killed.

On 9 June 2020, Mozambican military forces bombed Islamist militants in the forest in Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado), between Mbau and Mocimboa Sede. According to some reports, 22 members of the militia were killed.

Around 9 June 2020 (between 8 and 10 June), members of an Islamist militia entered the village of Tapara (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). They gathered all residents and killed a man after he was identified as a Christian; another man was killed after a gun was found in his house. The group set all the houses on fire and ordered the residents to move to Bilibiza. 3 women were abducted.

On 9 June 2020, the FDS forces of Mozambique, with support of the DAG, conducted a military operation against an Islamist militant base in Narere (also known as Marere) (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado). During the operation, 9 members of the group and 2 soldiers were killed. The FDS forces executed 13 prisoners taken from the base. A large cache of weapons and two armored cars were seized.
On 10 June 2020, an unknown armed group stole medicines and personal belongings from patients and staff in Nhamatanda (Nhamatanda) and set the place on fire. No fatalities reported.

On 10 June 2020, air strikes by the FDS were registered in the south of Mocimboa da Praia district (Cabo Delgado), in proximity to Muidumbe district. The bombing repelled members of an Islamist militia that were allegedly in the region. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
On 10 June 2020, a person was beheaded by members of an Islamist militia in Mitumbate (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado).

Around 11 June 2020 (between 10 -11 June), between 10 to 11 family leaders were killed by members of an Islamist militia in the Cabora neighborhood, Quiterajo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). According to a source, the group targeted Makonde ethnic group.

On 11 June 2020, DAG helicopter gunships launched strikes on Islamist militiamen, responding to calls of residents of Maculo (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) who were being attacked by members of an Islamist militia. It was not clear whether there were casualties.

On 11 June 2020, DAG helicopter gunships launched strikes on Islamist militiamen, responding to calls of residents of Cabaceira in Macimboa Da Praia district who were being attacked by members of an Islamist militia. It was not clear whether there were casualties.
On 12 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia beheaded a civilian in Ingoane (Macomia). Locals fled the village.

On 12 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked the village of Chinda, close to Mbau, Mocimboa Da Praia. A large group of militants conducted the attack and an unknown number of villagers were killed. Shops and houses were looted and destroyed. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 12 June 2020, Islamist militants beheaded 4 people near Nanjaba in Macomia (Cabo Delgado). The victims were heading to the Administrative Post of Mucojo on a motorbike.
On 13 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked Nacutuco (Macomia). No fatalities were reported.
On 13 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked Ingoane (Macomia) and one person was decapitated.
On 13 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked Manica (Macomia) for a third time. No fatalities were reported. Huts were burned down and people fled.

On 13 June 2020, the military forces of Mozambique supported by the helicopter gunships of the Dyck Advisory Group attacked Islamist militants in Chinda (Mocimboa Da Praia). No fatalities were reported.

On 14 June 2020, members of the FDS forces whipped civilians in Malinde (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) and demanded money from them as they returned to the city after a clash between the troops and members of an Islamist militia (coded separately). The soldiers also looted houses in the town before the return of its residents. No report on injuries.

On 14 June 2020, members of the FDS forces clashed with members of an Islamist militia in Malinde (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The group had, moments before, killed between 3 to 4 civilians, and destroyed a number of houses. According to sources, the FDS forces killed more than 15 militiamen during the action. Fatalities coded as 18.
On 15 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 2 people in Pangane (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group also kidnapped a child and another adult.
On 16 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed a man in Koko (Mocimboa Da Praia) and burned houses.
On 17 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia beheaded 4 people in Tororo (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). The group also kidnapped a woman.
Around 17 June 2020 (week of), Islamist militants burned a boat carrying fresh water to and from Ilha Quilhanhune in Macomia district. No fatalities were reported.
On 17 June 2020, two young sisters (aged 13 and 15) were abducted by suspected Islamist militants in Ilala village of Macomia district (Cabo Delgado). No fatalities were reported.

On 17 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed and mutilated 3 people (4 according to other sources) in Chimbanga (Mocimboa Da Praia). According to a source, they also kidnapped and assaulted a man, releasing him later.
On 18 June 2020, two girls were abducted in Ilala (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) by suspected Islamist militants.
On 18 June 2020, members of the FDS forces killed 1 civilian and injured another near Xitaxi (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado). Reason for killing not reported.
On 19 June 2020, members of an Islamist militia beheaded a civilian in Ntapuate (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). The group fired gunshots in the air and destroyed an unknown number of houses.
On 19 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked Xitaxi (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado) and destroyed several houses and businesses. No fatalities/casualties were reported.

On 21 June 2020, FDS soldier killed 6 members of an Islamist militia in the E380 road, between Mocimboa da Praia and Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado), during a ""combat patrol"". A firearm and ammunition were seized.

column6: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: On 21 June 2020, around 100 officers of the Rapid Intervention Unit seized objects, destroyed houses, beat and arbitrarily detained people in the residential zones of Nacala and Nabubussi, Nanduadua neighborhood, in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado), under operations to curb an Islamist militia. 12 people were arrested, and later released.

On 21 June 2020, prisoners allegedly held a demonstration in two prisons in Nampula (Nampula) due to lack of food. The vice minister of justice, however, denied the reports claiming there were no demonstrations. [size=no report]
Around 22 June 2020 (as reported), Islamist militants attacked Mitacata (Macomia) village. No fatalities were reported.
Around 22 June 2020 (as reported), Islamist militants attacked Natugo village (Quissanga). No fatalities were reported.
Around 22 June 2020 (as reported), Islamist militants attacked Napala village (Macomia). No fatalities were reported.
Around 23 June 2020 (between 22 - 23 June), military forces of the Mozambique conducted search operations in Milamba (Mocimboa Da Paria) and found large quantities of arms and ammunition.

On 23 June 2020, Mozambique's security forces discovered a mass grave in Mocimboa Da Praia district (Cabo Delgado). They were allegedly the bodies of members of an Islamist militia killed during a clash in Mocimboa da Praia in March 2020. The number of the bodies discovered was not reported. Fatalities coded as 10.
On 25 June 2020, Friends of the Earth Mozambique activists held a peaceful demonstration in Maputo (Maputo city) and called for a UN probe into Human Rights issues in Cabo Delgado. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: Around 25 June 2020 (between 25 and 26 June), 26 bodies were found in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado), suspected to be locals abducted by GSF forces as a response to the attacks perpetrated by an Islamist militia in the area.

column7: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: On 25 June 2020, members of the police's Rapid Intervention Unit and Special Operations Group questioned and physically abused women in the Kuliwayamba area of the Nanduadua neighborhood, Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado), under operations to curb an Islamist militia active in the area.

On 27 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) and took over the town. They were reportedly clearing the area of the DAG forces. ISCAP later claimed the attack and said that it killed 10 ""elements of the Southern Africa alliance and injured others and seized various weapons and ammunition"". The group stayed in the city for 3 days, and during the time, 12 Armed Forces members were killed, along with 40 civilians (at least eight of whom were killed in targeted attacks coded separately); several were injured. According to the SDF, over 100 militiamen were killed, but the number was not confirmed. According to witnesses, the majority of the civilian casualties were found in the Christian majority neighborhood 30 de Junho. 44 fatalities split across three events.

On 27 June 2020, Islamist militants killed 8 employees of a private company in a car ambush 4 km of Mocimboa Da Praia (Mociomboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado). 3 employees were missing; 3 managed to escape.
On 27 June 2020, Islamist militants abducted 10 people from Mocimboa Da Praia (Cabo Delgado). The whereabouts of the victims are not known.

column16: Cabo Ligado; VOA; HumAngle; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 28 June 2020, Islamist militants clashed with the Armed Forces after the group took control of Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) on the previous day (coded separately). The group stayed in the city for 3 days, and during the time, 12 Armed Forces members were killed, along with 40 civilians (at least eight of whom were killed in targeted attacks, coded separately); several were injured. According to sources, over 100 militiamen were killed, but the number was not confirmed. According to witnesses, the majority of the civilians killed were found in the Christian majority neighborhood 30 de Junho. 44 fatalities split across three events.
Around 28 June 2020 (between 27 and 30 June), members of an Islamist militia beheaded 3 people in Chimbanga (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado).

Around 29 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked civilians while in control of Mocimbo Da Praia (Mocimbo Da Praia, Cado Delgado). The group took control of the city on 27 June 2020, and stayed for three days. Witnesses confirmed the beheading of at least 8 people, including 6 from the same family, and the driver of a FRELIMO member.

column16: Carta de Mocambique; HumAngle; VOA; Cabo Ligado
column17: On 29 June 2020, Islamist militants clashed with the Armed Forces after the group took control of Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) two days earlier. The group stayed in the city for 3 days, and during the time, 12 Armed Forces members were killed, along with 40 civilians (at least eight of whom were killed in targeted attacks coded separately); several were injured. According to sources, over 100 militiamen were killed, but the number was not confirmed. According to witnesses, the majority of the civilians killed were found in the Christian majority neighborhood 30 de Junho. 44 fatalities split across three events.
On 29 June 2020, a man was beheaded by militiamen in Nivico (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). 1 fatality reported.
On 30 June 2020, Islamist militants attacked Quelimane (Palma, Cabo Delgado) as they were withdrawing from Mocimboa Da Praia. No fatalities were reported.
On 1 July 2020, around 250 former RMJ presented themselves in Muxungue (Chibabava, Sofala), in the context of the country's DDR efforts.
On 1 July 2020, an individual was killed after 13 armed individuals ambushed a bus in the Niassa-Muhoco region (Lichinga, Niassa). The group took all the passengers belongings.

On 1 July 2020, a land and air attack by FDS forces reportedly destroyed an Islamist militia base near Ntessa (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). Sources favorable to the government reported that 100 militiamen and between 12 to 15 security forces members were killed, mentioning that the soldiers took over the base. Another source indicated losses on both sides and that the base was still in the hands of the Islamist group.
Around 1 July 2020 (as reported), 3 dead bodies of young people were found in Tororo (Quissanga). Islamist militants were the suspected attackers.

Around 1 July 2020 (as reported), a woman was abducted by militiamen in the 19 de Outubro village (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado), known as ADPP crossing. She managed to run away. It was not reported whether she was injured.

On 2 July 2020, during a two day clash between Islamist militants and the Military in Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) displaced residents to the main city of Mueda district. Injuries and/or fatalities were not reported.
Around 3 July 2020 (weekend of), 160 members of RENAMO changed their affiliation to FRELIMO in a DDR ceremony in Dombe (Sussundenga, Manica).

On 3 July 2020, during a two day clash between Islamist militants and the Military Forces in Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado) displaced residents to the main city of Mueda district. Injuries and/or fatalities were not reported.
On 3 July 2020, insugents destroyed houses in Milamba village (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 4 July 2020, 3 men were killed during an attack by Islamist militants in Simbolongo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).
On 6 July 2020, a robbery suspect was beaten to death by a group in the Chota zone of Beira city (Beira, Sofala). [size=no report]
On 7 July 2020, more than 350 informal vendors gathered in the Zimpeto market office, Maputo (Maputo, Maputo City), to demand their inclusion in the market reorganization. [size=more than 350]
On 7 July 2020, members of the FDS forces killed 4 people suspected of supporting the Islamist Militia in Mocimboa Da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado).
On 7 July 2020, 4 civilians were killed in Anga (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). It was unclear whether the perpetrators were members from an Islamist militia or from the Armed Forces.

column16: Carta de Mocambique; O Pais; Miramar
column17: On 7 July 2020, victims of the Hulene dump collapse gathered in the Municipal Council of Maputo (Maputo, Maputo City), to demand the payment of housing subsides due by the government. [size=no report]
On 8 July 2020, 13 individuals were killed by Islamist militiamen as the group travelled from Mucojo to Ilala (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).

column16: VOA; Lusa; O Pais; Club Mozambique
column17: On 11 July 2020, the president of the CTA, and a member of the FRELIMO, was shot and injured by two armed individuals in Josina Machel avenue, near downtown Maputo. Motivation are unknown.
On 12 July 2020, Islamist militiamen killed two people and set two houses on fire in the Awasse village, Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa Da Praia, Cabo Delgado).
Around 13 July 2020 (week of), security forces killed 4 Islamist fighters in Ntessa (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). 2 others were arrested.

Around 13 July 2020 (as reported), members of the security forces killed and captured an unidentified number of Islamist fighters near Cagembe (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). They also destroyed the group's camp. Fatalities coded as 3.
On 13 July 2020, two people were killed after Islamist militiamen ambushed an ambulance in Milangueleia (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado).

column16: Cabo Ligado; Sala da Paz; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 14 July 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed a civilian and set 5 houses on fire in Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).

Around 14 July 2020 (between 14 and 15 July), 15 individuals were arrested by the FDS in Pemba (Pemba, Cabo Delgado). The group was reportedly tortured and later released. According to some sources, they confessed to be in a reconnaissance mission for an Islamist group, while other sources stated that they proved their innocence, being a group seeking refuge from the conflict in the north.

On 14 July 2020, soldiers assaulted a man and his mother in Nabubussi residential area, Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) and took money from them. No reports on the conditions of the victims.
On 14 July 2020, a person was killed during an attack of Islamist militiamen in Chai (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Houses were destroyed and good were looted.
On 15 July 2020, 20 people were killed by members of an Islamist militia in Mungue (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado) as the group was moving to Chai. They were wearing military uniforms.
Around 15 July 2020 (month of), 6 IDPs teenage girls were sexually assaulted by members of the military in Ibo (Ibo, Cabo Delgado).
On 15 July 2020, the Armed Forces clashed with Islamist militia members in Xitaxi (Muidumbe, Cado Delgado). During the shoot-out, 2 militia members and 8 civilians were killed.
On 17 July 2020, a man was killed by a group who mistook him for a robber in Tchumene, Matola (Namaacha, Maputo). [size=no report]

On 17 July 2020, the body of a man was found near Muagamula (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Residents believed he was ambushed by members of an Islamist militia; the victim was a security guard at a gospel radio station, but there is no indication that he was targeted because of his religion.
On 18 July 2020, the Armed Forces killed around 12 Islamist militia members in the district of Mocimboa da Praia (Cabo Delgado). The victims were placed in a mass grave, also in the region.

On 19 July 2020, members of an Islamist group abducted an unidentified number of women during an attack in the Paesse agricultural production center, Mussemuku (Mussemuco) (Ibo, Cabo Delgado). Injuries and/or fatalities were not reported.

column16: Club Mozambique; VOA; Carta de Mocambique; Miramar; O Pais
column17: On 20 July 2020, armed forces clashed with members of the RENAMO in a base close to Dombe (Sussundenga, Manica). During the shoot-out, 5 RENAMO members were killed; three AK-47 and seven charges were seized.
On 21 July 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 2 people, kidnapped 4 girls, and raided houses in Mucojuco (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).

On 23 July 2020, members of an Islamist militia raided and set houses on fire in Manica (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities. The group arrived in the village on 23 July and left 25 July.
On 23 July 2020, 2 people were killed, and several women were abducted by members of an Islamist militia in Mucojuco (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group also burnt a boat.

Around 24 July 2020 (between 23 - 25 July), members of an Islamist militia kidnapped between 6 and 11 women in Manica (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group arrived in the village on 23 July and left 25 July.

On 25 July 2020, between 2 and 4 people (according to different sources) were killed during an attack by an Islamist militia in Novo Cabo Delgado (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group also burnt houses. The village is inhabited by several IDPs from the region.

column6: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: On 25 July 2020, a man was shot and killed by the police in Fomento neighborhood, Matola (Namaacha, Maputo) for breaking measures related to the coronavirus. The officer was arrested.

On 26 July 2020, 4 civilians were killed during an attack by an Islamist Militia in Novo Cabo Delgado (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The attack was perpetrated by seven people, 5 armed with 2 machetes; two of whom were killed. Houses were set on fire.

column6: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: Around 28 July 2020 (as reported), Rapid Intervention Unit officers reportedly beat civilians who refused to pay money demanded by them in Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).

On 28 July 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with a local self defense unit in Litanduacau (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) after the former attacked the city, killing between 2 to 3 civilians (according to different sources) and seizing goods. During the shoot-out, 12 Islamist militiamen were killed.

column6: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: On 28 July 2020, an off-duty Municipal and Inspection police officer was shot and killed by members of the Rapid Intervention Unit in front of his house in Nampula (Nampula, Nampula). The officer was killed after the officers ordered him to identify himself. No reports on arrests.

On 28 July 2020, a person was killed during an attack by 10 members of an Islamist militia in the area of Nabubussi, Milemba neighborhood, Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The group intercepted a truck carrying goats and rice, killed one animal, seized the goods and burnt several houses.

On 29 July 2020, shop sellers attempted to forcibly enter the Zimpeto Grossista Market in Maputo (Maputo City), which has been closed due to coronavirus-related measures. Police prevented the group fro entering. [size=no report]
Around 29 July 2020 (between 29 - 30 July), 9 people were killed during an attack by an Islamist militia in Milemba neighborhood, Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado).
On 30 July 2020, 4 girls were kidnapped by members of an Islamist militia in Manica (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group also raided the village. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
On 31 July 2020, Islamist militiamen in Litanduacau (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) raided goods and set houses on fire. Conflicting reports suggest between zero and two fatalities.

Around 31 July 2020 (between 31 July - 1 August), 7 women were kidnapped by members of an Islamist militia in Manica (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group also raided the village. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

Around 31 July 2020 (as reported), fisherwomen gathered in front of the Fishery Port in Maputo (Maputo) in a demonstration against the Municipal police action, which was taking their merchandise. [size=no report]

On 5 August 2020, armed forces clashed with members of an Islamist militia in the district of Quissanga (Cabo Delgado). 12 members of the militia were killed; the armed forces destroyed an advanced observation and control post in the proximities of the camps known as Syria 1 and Syria 2. Among the fatalities, was an alleged female Ugandan national.
On 5 August 2020, an attack was registered in Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) by an Islamist militia.
On 5 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia kidnapped residents of Anga (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado), raided goods and set houses on fire. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

On 5 August 2020, FDS forces, with support of DAG, clashed with an Islamist militia in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). Clashes were registered until 11 August. Independent investigations reported between 60 to 90 government fatalities, over 100 injured and up to 40 missing. 60 fatalities split across 7 events.

column16: Amaq; Cabo Ligado; Nashir; Sala da Paz
column17: On 6 August 2020, armed forces clashed with members of an Islamist militia in Mocimboa da Praia (Cabo Delgado). A statement published by the Islamic State Central African Province (ISCAP) claimed that 50 members of the armed forces were killed or injured. The group also claimed to have ransacking 2 of the military bases. Clashes were registered from 5 August to 11 August. Independent investigations reported between 60 to 90 government fatalities, over 100 injured and up to 40 missing. 60 fatalities split across 7 events.
Around 6 August 2020 (between 5 and 7 August), members of an Islamist militia gained control of the city of 1 de Maio (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) after a clash with FDS forces.
On 7 August 2020, a baby was killed and three other people were injured by presumed Renamo Military Junta members on the EN1 road, close to Muxungue (Chibabava, Sofala).
On 7 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia gained control of Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) during ongoing clashes with the Armed Forces. Fatalities unknown.
On 7 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia gained control of Anga (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) during ongoing clashes with the Armed Forces. Fatalities unknown.

On 7 August 2020, clashes between Armed Forces, with support of DAG, and an Islamist group were registered in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). Civilians fled the area. Clashes were registered from 5 August to 11 August. Independent investigation reported between 60 to 90 government fatalities, over 100 injured and up to 40 missing. 60 fatalities split across 7 events.

On 7 August 2020, unidentified armed individuals opened fire against a bus that had just left Muxungue (Chibabava, Sofala). A child was shot and killed, and 3 other people were shot and injured. Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 8 August 2020, clashes between the armed forces and an Islamist group were registered in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The Islamist group also targeted Chinese nationals during the attacks. The Islamist group claimed to have killed or wounded 50 soldiers while government supporters claimed 128 Islamist Militia members killed. Clashes were registered from 5 August to 11 August. Independent investigations reported between 60 to 90 government fatalities, over 100 injured and up to 40 missing. 60 fatalities split across 7 events.

Around 8 August 2020 (between 7 August - 9 August), members of Islamist militia took control of Ntotwe (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) after a clash with members of the FDS forces. A number of soldiers were killed and/or wounded. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
On 8 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia gained control of the city of Ntotue (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) after a clash with FDS forces.
On 8 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked Ncomangano (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

On 8 August 2020, five members of an Islamist Militia wearing uniforms similar to the armed forces attacked Litandacua (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). 5 civilians were killed; 7 houses burnt down. Several IDPs from the region are currently in the village.

Around 8 August 2020 (between 8 - 9 August), 10 members of an Islamist Militia attacked Nambo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group killed 2 civilians, kidnapped 4 women and 3 children, and burnt houses.

On 9 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia and the armed forces clashed in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). Mobile phone towers and most of the power lines were destroyed. Clashes were registered from 5 August to 11 August. Independent investigations reported between 60 to 90 government fatalities, over 100 injured and up to 40 missing. 60 fatalities split across 7 events.

On 10 August 2020, heavy clashes between members of an Islamist militia and the FDS forces, with assistance of a private security group (DAG) were registered in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The group used a rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) to sink a Mozambique's HSI32 Interceptor ship. Clashes were registered from 5 August to 11 August. Independent investigations reported between 60 to 90 government fatalities, over 100 injured and up to 40 missing. 60 fatalities split across 7 events.

On 10 August 2020, a Zimbabwean national was killed with machete blows by a mob after he shot a Mozambican during a robbery attempt. The group took his body to the border with Zimbabwe, in Chidodo. [size=no reports]

On 10 August 2020, 15 military trucks were ambushed by members of an Islamist Militia on a road between Mueda and Mocimboa da Praia in the Awasse area (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). 55 armed forces members were killed.
On 10 August 2020, an armed clash between members of an Islamist Militia and the armed forces was registered in Chai (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). 4 soldiers were killed and several were wounded.

column16: VOA; Reuters; Club Mozambique; Cabo Ligado; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 11 August 2020, armed clashes between an Islamist militia and the armed forces, with assistance of a private security force (DAG) was reported in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia). The militia took control of the city's port. In statement by the group, pictures of killed armed forces were posted. Clashes were registered from 5 August. Independent investigations reported between 60 to 90 government fatalities, over 100 injured and up to 40 missing. 60 fatalities split across 7 events.

On 12 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia kidnapped 2 Brazilian nuns in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The group had controlled the city in the previous day, following 5 days of clashes with the FDS forces. The nuns were released on 6 September 2020.

Around 12 August 2020 (between 12 and 13 August), members of an Islamist militia attacked Olumbi (Palma, Cabo Delgado). According to sources, the group managed seize short control of the village. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
Around 13 August 2020 (as reported), a man was kidnapped by unidentified individuals in the Chinonanquila zone, Boane (Boane, Maputo).

On 13 August 2020, more than 40 displaced civilians in two boats were killed by government troops while on their way to Nhongue island from Ncomangano (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). One of the boats was set on fire, and the other sank.

Around 15 August 2020 (between 15 and 16 August), 3 boats of the Sofala district Community Fisheries Council were set on fire in Praia Nova, Beira (Beira, Sofala). 2 men were arrested. According to the Council officers, the event was motivated by the organization's inspection to prevent illegal fishing practices.
On 15 August 2020, a man was abducted by armed individuals in Maquinino neighborhood, Beira (Beira, Sofala). According to witnesses, the perpetrators were wearing masks and police uniforms.

On 15 August 2020, clashes were registered between FDS forces and an Islamist militia in the city and region of Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). No report on fatalities and/or casualties.

column6: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: On 15 August 2020, the body of a man was found near the EM380 road, in the Macomia region (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The victim had been arrested the day prior by members of the Rapid Intervention Unit.

Around 16 August 2020 (between 15 and 16 August), 2 woman were sexually assaulted and killed by members of the FDS, and their bodies found in Nawamba, near Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). They were IDPs.
On 19 August 2020, a minibus was ambushed, and at least 2 individuals were killed by members of an Islamic militia near Litandacua (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The vehicle managed to arrive at Chai.

column16: Carta de Mocambique; Miramar; O Pais
column17: On 19 August 2020, public minibus operators halted their activities and prevented others to circulate in Maputo (Maputo), in a demonstration against the 12-passengers cap imposed by presidential decree regarding coronavirus-related measures, the alteration of routes, and alleged excessive fines imposed by the municipal police. The police were called to control the situation, but no physical intervention was reported. [size=no report]

On 20 August 2020, bus drivers halted their activities and gathered in the Inhagoia stop at Mocambique avenue, Maputo (Maputo), in a demonstration against the 12-passengers cap imposed by presidential decree regarding coronavirus-related measures, and alleged excessive fines imposed by the municipal police. The police was called to control the situation, but no physical intervention was reported. [size=no report]

On 20 August 2020, 384 RENAMO commanders presented themselves in the vicinity of Mount Gorongosa (Caia, Sofala), in the context of the country's DDR efforts. The officers were part of the Renamo General Chiefs of Staff in the region and were close to the party leader.

column16: AIM; Cabo Ligado; MediaFax (Mozambique); Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 21 August 2020, between 4 and 7 people were beheaded by members of an Islamist militia in Mionge island (Cabo Delgado). They stole goods and kidnapped 10 people (according to some sources 29 people were kidnapped). The island has become a destination and transit point for IDPs of Mocimboa da Praia.
On 21 August 2020, members of an Islamic militia seized 3 Navy vessels with engines (2 x 40 horsepower and 1 x 25 horsepower) in or near Mionge island (Miongue island, Cabo Delgado).

column16: Jornal de Noticias; Miramar; AFP; O Pais; Carta de Mocambique; VOA; Club Mozambique
column17: On 23 August 2020, the offices of Canal de Mocambique and CanalMoz were set on fire by unidentified individuals in Maputo (Maputo, Maputo). According to the paper Executive Director (who suffered a kidnap attempt in 2019), remains of homemade bombs and cans of fuel were found inside the building.
On 24 August 2020, a cement truck was attacked by members of an Islamist militia in Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

On 25 August 2020, members of the ASSOFRAMA gathered in the Sol beach, Maputo (Maputo, Sofala) to demand a return to their activities. Hundreds of vendors have been ordered to stop their activities in the region during the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]
On 25 August 2020, an attack by members of an Islamist militia was registered in the island of Mechamba (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). No further information available at the time of reporting.

On 26 August 2020, several families, victims of the Iday cyclone (2019), gathered in front of the office and then in front of the official residence of the governor of Sofala in Beira (Beira, Sofala), to demand justice in the payment of subsidies disrupted due to coronavirus-related measures. The payment was suspended after the demonstration while the government tried to find a better method to deliver the payments. [size=several]

Around 26 August 2020 (week of), around 1,000 IDPs from Mocimboa da Praia and surrounding villages arrived in Pangane (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) fleeing the area's conflict. Around 5,000 IDPs are currently in the village, and according to a resident, 14 boats have arrived in the past days, with 4 further going to Pemba.
On 27 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked military forces in Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

column16: Cabo Ligado; Carta de Mocambique; AIM
column17: Around 27 August 2020 (between 26 - 29 August), members of the FDS destroyed 5 control posts and 21 huts set up by members of an Islamist militia in Mbau (Mbau, Cabo Delgado). 9 militiamen were killed.

On 28 August 2020, FDS forces intercepted 2 boats coming from Nampula with 60 people on board in Pemba (Pemba, Cabo Delgado). The officers reportedly deployed arms to gain control of the boats. According to reports, Nampula is a recruitment point for the insurgency. Other reports indicated that there were 3 boats, intercepted with the help of the DAG. One of the boats sunk, killing 9 people.
On 28 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked the village of Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado).
On 28 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked civilians in Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

On 28 August 2020, thousands of victims of the Iday cyclone (2019) gathered in front of the governor's office in Beira (Beira, Sofala) in a demonstration against the suspension of assistance payments two days earlier after another demonstration. The police oversaw the demonstration without intervention. [size=thousand]
On 29 August 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked the village of Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). Several residents fled the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 29 August 2020, IDPs from Chitunda, Xitaxi, and Miangalewa arrived in Namacande (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado) after members of local militias sent out messages on 27 and 28 August for residents of those cities to leave the region.

column16: AIM; Jasmine Oppermann; Cabo Ligado; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 30 August 2020, members of the FDS clashed with members of an Islamist militia in Milangelewa (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado) as the state troops were moving north for reinforcements. In addition, several weapons were sized and several members of the militia were killed. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 30 August 2020, unidentified individuals opened fire against a bus for the Mozambican post on the N6 National Road, Chibabava district (Sofala). The vehicle was traveling between Maputo and Zambezia. Reports differ on the number of injured: 1 or 2 drivers.

On 31 August 2020, victims of the Iday cyclone (2019) gathered in front of the governor's office in Beira (Beira, Sofala) in a demonstration against the suspension of assistance payments. The governor left his office and addressed the population, asking them to return to their houses. [size=no report]
Around 31 August 2020 (as reported), 3 beheaded bodied were found in the Nanjaua village (Ancuabe, Cabo Delgado). According to reports, an Islamist militia beheaded the people.
On 1 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked Quelimane (Palma, Cabo Delgado). Residents fled the village. No reports on fatalities and/or injuries.
On 1 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked Nambo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group set several houses on fire; beheaded a man and killed another.

On 2 September 2020, a police officer was shot and killed and another injured by unidentified individuals in Maputo (Maputo). The perpetrators were in a car when they were approached by the officers, opening fire against them.

Around 2 September 2020 (week of), members of an Islamist militia attacked the island of Metundo (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The group destroyed the huts of several IDPs. The main island village is reportedly still occupied by the group (as reported on 10 September 2020).

column16: AIM; O Pais; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 3 September 2020, a demobilized Renamo member was killed by unidentified armed individuals in Panja (Chibabava, Sofala). Motivation is unknown.
Around 3 September 2020 (as reported), civilians fleeing from attacks perpetrated by members of the RENAMO Junta are reaching Gondola (Gondola, Manica), and surrounding villages.

On 5 September 2020, a convoy of around 200 FDS members clashed with an Islamist militia on the N380, near Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The group set two vehicles on fire; with causalities on both sides.
On 5 September 2020, 140 RENAMO women presented themselves in the Mapangapanga base, in Vunduzi (Gorongosa, Sofala), in the context of the country's DDR efforts.

On 5 September 2020, a clash was registered between unidentified armed individuals and officers of the FDS forces and soliders which ISIS claims were members of the Tanzanian militiary in Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). Several vehicles were set on fire, and 4 were seized, together with weapons and ammunitions. ISIS claimed to have killed 20 Tanzanians officers during the clash, however this fatalities were denied and could not be corroborated. Details of this event are unclear.

On 5 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia burned 3 houses, looted solar panels, batteries, a boat, and other goods in the Vamizi island (Palma, Cabo Delgado). No reported injuries or fatalities.

Around 6 September 2020 (between 6 - 7 September), an Islamist militia attacked Manica (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group raided the village, stealing food, gas and goats. No reports on fatalities or injuries. The group remained in the village until 7 September.
Around 7 September 2020 (between 6 September - 7 September) members of an Islamist militia attacked Rueia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group caused heavy damage in the village.

column16: Amnesty International; Al Jazeera; Lusa; Cabo Ligado; BBC News; O Pais; AFP; AIM; VOA; Carta de Mocambique; HRW; Miramar
column17: Around 7 September 2020 (as reported), a naked woman was beaten and shot 36 times by 4 members of the FDS forces near Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). In the video published, showing the attack, the officers were accusing the woman of being a member of an Islamist militia.

column16: AIM; Cabo Ligado; Tribune de Geneve
column17: Around 8 September 2020 (between 7 September - 9 September), members of an Islamist militia attacked the island of Vamizi (Palma, Cabo Delgado). Houses and boats were set on fire. A report indicated that a woman was kidnapped, while other stated that a man was killed. The island currently houses several IPDs.
On 8 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked Nambo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group set several houses on fire; beheaded a man and burnt another to death.
On 8 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked the island of Quifuqui (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The group set several houses and IDPs huts on fire.

On 9 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia set houses and IDPs huts on fire in the Island of Metundo (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). According to a report, they also took control of the island.

Around 9 September 2020 (between 8 September - 9 September), members of an Islamist militia attacked Olumbua (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group raided and set houses on fire; most of the population had left the village prior to the attack. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

column8: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Rapid Intervention Unit
column17: On 9 September 2020, 2 Rapid Intervention Unit offices were injured during an attack by the RMJ in Muxungue (Chibabava, Sofala).
On 10 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked the village of Maputo (Palma, Cabo Delgado). The population fled to Muite. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 11 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked a village near Pundanhar (Palma, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 11 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked the island of Vamizi (Palma, Cabo Delgado). Houses, a lodge, and boats were set on fire. The island currently houses several IPDs. No reports on fatalities.

On 11 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked a camp of the FDS forces in the vicinity of Changa (Chianga) (Nagade, Cabo Delgado). During the clash, 2 soldiers were killed and 1 was injured.
On 11 September 2020, 4 people were killed by members of an Islamist militia in Changa (Chianga) (Nagade, Cabo Delgado). The group also destroyed several houses.

column16: AFP; Carta de Mocambique; Cabo Ligado
column17: On 12 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 2 people and injured several individuals during a vehicle ambush, near the 10 Congresso production facility, close to Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado). Among the victims, a Bangladesh national.

Around 12 September 2020 (between 11 and 12 September), between 20 to 30 civilians were killed by members of an Islamist militia during an ambush in a road leading to Pundanhar (Palma, Cabo Delgado). According to sources, 24 victims of the attack were buried in Palma.
On 12 September 2020, 2 people were injured during an attack by members of an Islamist militia in Maganja (Palma, Cabo Delgado).

On 12 September 2020, FDS forces clashed with an Islamist militia in Manilha (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado) as the security forces were traveling to Mocimboa da Praia. No report on fatalities and/or injuries.

On 13 September 2020, a journalist was attacked by unidentified individuals in Nampula (Nampula, Nampula). The perpetrators took his camera, which was later left in a police station with pictures that showed suspected members of the Frelimo Party who infiltrated an event of the opposition party, Renamo, deleted.

On 13 September 2020, a journalist was kidnapped, tied-up, beaten and injured by unidentified individuals, and left in a beach in Maxixe (Cidade de Maxixe, Inhambane). The perpetrators stole his identity documents, two mobile phones and a tape recorder, and threatened him.
On 13 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia seized chickens and cooking pans from the locals in Manica (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). An attempt to abduct women failed.
On 13 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia burned houses and seized food supplies in Ningaia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).
Around 13 September 2020 (between 12 - 14 September), members of an Islamist militia injured 3 people during an attack in Quissenge (Palma, Cabo Delgado). Several houses were set on fire.

Around 13 September 2020 (between 13 - 14 September), members of the FDS forces clashed with members of an Islamist militia near Diaca (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). 5 to 6 members of the militia were killed.

On 14 September 2020, 7 people were killed after they tried to open an explosive they found in a community in Pebane district (Zambezia). The police was unable to identify the nature of the explosive.
On 14 September 2020, an attack by suspected members of the RMJ was registered on the road between Quilemane and Beira (Beira, Sofala). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
On 15 September 2020, 2 people were beheaded by members of an Islamist militia in the district of Macomia (Cabo Delgado).
On 15 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia seized a considerable number of fish from locals in Namadoro (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).

On 16 September 2020, the son of a RMJ leader was shot and injured by members of the FDS forces in Chiadua (Nhamatanda, Sofala). Two children of the RMJ leader were also taken by the police and tortured to reveal the hideout used by his father.

column16: O Pais; VOA; Jornal de Noticias; Lusa
column17: On 17 September 2020, members of the RMJ opened fire against a passenger vehicle in the N1 road, Chibabava district (Sofala). No one was injured and another attack was registered simultaneously on the same road in Nhamatanda district (coded separately).

column16: O Pais; VOA; Jornal de Noticias; Lusa; Undisclosed Source
column17: On 17 September 2020, members of the RMJ opened fire against a passenger vehicle and injured 7 people (between 3 to 4 seriously) on the N1 road in Nhamatanda district (Sofala). Another attack was registered simultaneously on the same road in Chibabava district (coded separately).

On 17 September 2020, 2 people were beheaded according to locals by members of an Islamist militia near the village of Kiwiya, Quionga (Pemba, Cabo Delgado). Reports differ on whether were cutting poles for building or working on the fields.
On 18 September 2020, 2 fishermen were kidnapped by members of an Islamist militia in Pangane beach (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).
On 18 September 2020, 2 people were beheaded by members of an Islamist militia in Pundanhar (Palma, Cabo Delgado).

On 18 September 2020, DAG bombed areas between Licangano and Xinavane, south-west of Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) after they were called about suspicious movements of people in the region. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
On 20 September 2020, 2 bodies were found near Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The two were allegedly killed by members of an Islamist militia.

On 20 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia raided the village of Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group shot in air to disperse the community members in the Village. No injuries reported.

column16: O Pais; VOA; DW; Twitter; AIM; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 20 September 2020, between 1 and 2 people died and 8 were injured during an attack by suspected RMJ on the EN1 road between Inchope and Gorongosa (Caia, Sofala). The cars that were attacked were being escorted by police officers. The group denied the attack.

On 22 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 2 people, and beat others in Cagembe (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado) after the group entered the city and accused the residents of looting one of their bases.
On 22 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia beheaded 5 individuals who were leaving the fields back to their residences near Novo Cabo Delgado (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).

Around 23 September 2020 (week of), members of an Islamist militia beheaded and tortured residents of Chai (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). Some civilians were sent to Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) to relay a message that government troops should withdraw. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

Around 23 September 2020 (week of), members of an Islamist militia set houses on fire in Nabubussi neighborhood, Mocimboa da Praia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). The area was one of the few with residents in the city.

Around 23 September 2020 (between 23 - 24 September), members of an Islamist militia clashed with members of the FDS forces in the Naliendele region (Palma, Cabo Delgado). There were causalities on both sides; witnesses reported 2 FDS officers bodies being found after the clash.
On 24 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 7 residents of Mucojo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) and burned houses.
Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), students gathered in front of the UniLicungo University in Beira (Beira, Sofala) in a demonstration to demand the payment of late subsidies. [size=no report]
On 24 September 2020, 2 people were killed by members of an Islamist militia at the entrance to Pundanhar (Palma, Cabo Delgado). The group also set a car on fire.

On 24 September 2020, an employee of a energy company was killed by members of an Islamist militia in Awasse (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado), while working on an energy line with other colleagues, who escaped the attack. The militiamen set a vehicle on fire.
On 24 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 5 soldiers at a military position in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado). The group also took their weapons.
On 24 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia attacked Mahate (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

column16: Cabo Ligado; Twitter; VOA; AIM; Pinnacle News
column17: On 24 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with FDS forces in Bilibiza (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). The group reportedly killed between 5 to 8 civilians and kidnapped 200 people, the majority women. They destroyed houses and other proprieties in the city.

Around 25 September 2020 (between 25 - 26 September), hundreds of IDPs arrived in the Metuge district (Cabo Delgado), after an attack by members of an Islamist militia in Bilibiza on 24 September 2020 (coded separately).

On 26 September 2020, clashes between members of an Islamist militia and FDS forces, with support of the DAG, were registered in mangroves between Quissanga (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado) and Tandanhague leading to Quirimba and Ibo islands. The group reportedly shot at 4 choppers and a plane, with unverified references to rocket launchers being used. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
Around 26 September 2020 (as reported), the bodies of 6 family members were found beheaded in the Communal village, Messalo river (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado).

column16: VOA; AIM; O Pais; Miramar; Twitter; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 27 September 2020, 2 people were killed, and between 4 and 5 (including 2 children) were injured by suspected members of the RMJ in a road near Dombe (Sussundenga, Manica).

On 28 September 2020, 2 workers of an electric company were attacked by members of an Islamist militia in Chitunda (Muidumbe, Cabo Delgado). One of the workers escaped, the other was shot and injured; he was ordered to send a message to the government to not to return to the village to restore the power line.

On 28 September 2020, a man and a woman were abducted by members of an Islamist militia in Nyica do Rovuma (Palma, Cabo Delgado) to obtain information about the village. The woman's whereabouts is unknown.

column9: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Mozambican Frontier Guard
column17: On 28 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with soldiers and border guards in Nyica do Rovuma (Palma, Cabo Delgado), near the border of Tanzania. A border guard was killed, and the group set the village on fire. Before the clash, a couple was captured to gain information on the village, the man escaped, but the woman whereabout has not been determined.
Around 28 September 2020 (as reported), residents were supplied with firearms, creating militias in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado), after several attacks by members of an Islamist militia in the region.
On 30 September 2020, the FDS forces clashed with members of an Islamist militia in Mucojo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

On 30 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with the FDS forces in Mucojo (Macomia Cabo Delgado). The group set houses and public buildings on fire and occupied the village. Several people were tortured, with sources reporting several beheaded, and sent to inform government officials not to encourage people to return to villages already evacuated. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 30 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia set two trucks transporting cattle on fire on a road that connects Mucojo to Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The trucks were from a farm located near Pangane (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities or the whereabouts of the drivers.

On 30 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia clashed with members of the FDS forces in Pangane (Macomia, Cabo Delgado), as the militia entered the city targeting the military post. No fatalities and/or casualties reported.
On 30 September 2020, members of an Islamist militia killed 3 residents during an attack in Rueia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado).
On 30 September 2020, a member of the RMJ was killed by officers of the FDS forces in the province of Sofala.

On 1 October 2020, more than 200 truck drivers stopped their vehicles on the side of the National Road 1, in Marracuene district (Maputo) in a demonstration against their working conditions. [size=more than 200]
Around 1 October 2020 (between 30 September and 2 October), members of an Islamist militia attacked Manica (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
Around 1 October 2020 (between 30 September and 2 October), members of an Islamist militia attacked Mucojo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

Around 1 October 2020 (between 30 September and 3 October), members of an Islamist militia attacked the villages of Messano, Muitoro and Crimize, near Mucojo (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
Around 1 October 2020 (between 30 September and 2 October), members of an Islamist militia attacked Nambija (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
Around 1 October 2020 (between 30 September and 2 October), members of an Islamist militia attacked Naunde (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.

Around 1 October 2020 (between 30 September and 2 October), members of an Islamist militia clashed with the FDS forces in Pangane (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The official residence of the local chief was set on fire and a number of residents were taken as hostages. No reports of injuries and/or fatalities.
Around 1 October 2020 (between 1 and 2 October), members of an Islamist militia attacked Rueia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). 6 people were killed.
On 3 October 2020, members of an Islamist militia set houses alight in Crimiza village (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 3 October 2020, members of an Islamist militia set houses alight in Naunde village (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 3 October 2020, members of a communal militia clashed with at least 7 members of an Islamist militia in Magaia (Mocimboa da Praia, Cabo Delgado). 5 Islamist militiamen were captured; 2 managed to escape. No reports on injuries and/or fatalities.
On 5 October 2020, members of the FDS forces opened fire on 2 people suspected to be part of an Islamist militia in Palma (Palma, Cabo Delgado). 1 of the suspects were killed.

On 6 October 2020, the governments of Malawi and Mozambique reactivated the joint Commission for Defense and Security during a meeting with representatives in Songo (Cahora Bassa, Tete). The commission involves matters related to security between the two countries, including the fight against organized crime, illegal immigration, terrorism and trafficking in people and drugs.
Around 6 October 2020 (as reported), more than 1,000 individuals arrived in Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado) after several attacks on villages around Mucojo by a suspected Islamist militia.

On 6 October 2020, suspected RMJ members attacked a bus escorted by the police on the NR1, between Mutindiri and Muxungue (Chibabava, Sofala). At least 5 people were injured, one in serious condition according to some sources. It is unclear whether security forces engaged the suspected RMJ.
On 7 October 2020, 2 people were killed by about 7 members of an Islamist militia in the Macaloe islands (Makalowe) (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group also set houses on fire.

Around 8 October 2020 (as reported), DAG helicopters attacks against members of an Islamist militia in the mangrove between Ibo and Quirimba islands (Ibo, Cabo Delgado) were reported. According to government sources, an undisclosed number of militia members were killed. Fatalities coded as 3.

column16: Radio e Televisao Academica de Mocambique
column17: On 9 October 2020, a businessman was kidnapped by 3 armed individuals in Beira (Beira, Sofala).

Around 10 October 2020 (between 9 and 12 October), members of an Islamist militia clashed with members of the FDS forces in Nambo (Mucojo, Cado Delgado). During the attack in the village, the group killed 3 people, kidnapped 2 others, and destroyed several properties.

Around 10 October 2020 (between 9 and 12 October), members of an Islamist militia clashed with members of the FDS forces in Pangane (Mucojo, Cado Delgado). During the attack in the village, the group killed 7 people (2 were members of the FDS forces), kidnapped 60 others, and destroyed several properties.

column16: O Pais; Miramar; Carta de Mocambique
column17: On 13 October 2020, a businessman of Indian origin was shot and killed by unidentified individuals in Maputo (Maputo, Maputo). According to sources, he had resisted a kidnapping attempt.

column17: Around 13 October 2020 (between 13 and 14 October), the FDS forces clashed with members of an Islamist militia in Nacate (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). During the attack, several houses were set on fire, and a girl was killed; no other reports on injures and/or fatalities.
On 14 October 2020, several villagers were injured during an attack by members of an Islamist militia in Namala, 20 km from Olumbe (Palma, Cabo Delgado). Houses were set on fire.
On 14 October 2020, 2 people were killed by members of an Islamist militia during an attack in Indique/Ndique (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado).

On 14 October 2020, members of the FDS forces clashed with members of an Islamist militia in Macomia (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). The group burned houses during the attack; a woman died inside a burning house.

Around 16 October 2020 (between 16 and 17 October), members of an Islamist militia clashed with the FDS forces in Churumba/Chirumba (Quissanga, Cabo Delgado). The group of militiamen also burnt houses in the village.

column7: Mueda Communal Militia (Mozambique); Dyck Advisory Group

During clashes between 16 to 18 October, government sources claimed that 270 militiamen were killed and 7 trucks loaded with equipment were seized from the group. These fatalities could not be corroborated.

On 16 October 2020, members of an Islamist militia looted and destroyed houses in Olumbi (Palma, Cabo Delgado).

An incident that took place recently in which three members of the general public attacked a patrolling police vehicle in Tsumebs Soweto area early in the morning. Following an altercation in a bar, three men decided to construct an illegal three-men roadblock and attack police officers.
