Christian youths riot following an attack on a church. Three bystanders dead.
A vigilante group sympathetic to the victims of a bombed church lynches an innocent person they believe to be involved.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram kills three police officers and one civilians during a shootout.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen kill a police officer.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two government officials in a localized area. It is believed two shootings are connected.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two government officials in a localized area. It is believed two shootings are connected.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen killed three policemen when they hurled explosives and opened fire on a police station in Nigeria's restive north.

column6: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
column17: Two Russian sailors employed by a private shipping firm are taken hostage by suspected pirates while their ship is docked in Port Harcourt. MEND Spokesman Jomo Gbomo, MEND spokesman, claimed responsibility for attacks.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack a primary school, but there were no injuries reported.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces open fire on a car transporting members of Boko Haram, killing four, when the vehicle failed to stop at a check point.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A botched bomb placed near a University kills only the attackers.

column6: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
column17: MEND shoots and kills four soldiers near the Brass-Ogbia waterways of Bayelsa State. MEND later claimed they killed more than ten soldiers.

column7: Unity of Muslims and Christians in Nigeria
column17: Muslims and Christians in Port Harcourt yesterday staged a demonstration to condemn the Boko Haram violence in parts of the country.
Four soldiers are attacked by gunmen in the Delta region and are presumed killed. Their bodies were discover less than a week later.

column6: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
column17: MEND gunmen kill four police and four soldiers on patrol on the Nembe River in the southern portion of the state.
Suspected ritual killers behead a two-year-old girl.
Thirty killed in a clash between ethnic communities.

An irate mob lit bonfires and marched through the Nigerian city of Kano to protest the alleged shooting to death of a motorcyclist by troops deployed to counter Boko Haram Islamists. The group pleated police with stones and lit fires in the street.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces killed three suspected Boko Haram militants when they are caught in the act attempting to burn down a secular school.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen attacked the home of a senior Nigerian policeman Monday killing at least two officers on guard. It is widely believed to be the work of Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Islamists attacked a police station, prison and several government officers. At least three officers wounded.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces attack a Boko Haram holding. One soldier shot, five bandits arrested.

On Wednesday in Minna, Niger State capital, attack averted when a major oil marketer, Mrs. Justina Udeh refused to take delivery of what turned out to be an envelope containing some Improvised Ordinance Devices (IOD) sent to her by some unidentified persons at her business premises.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen attack a police station and two banks in the north. Four police killed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column9: Military Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
column17: Nigerian security forces and British Special forces attempt to rescue a British and Italian civilian kidnapped by Boko Haram in 2011. The bodies of the two men were discovered killed by their captors.
Employees of a psychiatric protested after the government appointed a new director that they found unfavorable. 6

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen have shot dead a senior police officer in charge of a special squad to fight robbery in northern Nigeria's Adamawa state. The assailant is suspected to be Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attacked a police station injuring three officers.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Police in northeast Nigeria's Borno state have repelled an attack on a police post by suspected Islamists, killing one and arresting 11 others.
Arrests: Security forces arrest over 100 suspects, including two students, in connection of a killing at a technical school in recent days.
Retired police officers gather to protest pension payments.
Reprisal attacks by Christian youths in the central Nigerian city of Jos killed more than 10 people on Sunday, after suspected Islamist militants bombed a church

A journalist with the newspaper Zion Nationale, was arrested by an officer of the State Security Service, for having exposed a case of corruption involving the ex wife of the former governor of Delta State. Upon his release from jail the reported has received death threats from unidentified callers.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide bomber drove a bomb laden car into a Catholic church in suburban Jos killing at least 14, including himself. 22 injured. Following the blast a gunman shot dead three civilians. A conflicting report has seven dead.
Drive-by shooting target police throughout Kano.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen attacked the residence of former Chairman of Kukawa Local Council of Borno State, Alhaji Bukar Abacha, shooting him dead before his wife and children in Fezzan Ward of Maiduguri.
A group of landlords protest land devaluation near a government building.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Unidentified gunmen threw explosives at a police patrol, killing a police officer, a soldier and a civilian.
A group gathers to protest violence against a church on March 11.
Okunran fighters attack a rival village, Egbe, over land.
Police and soldiers reportedly attack and beat journalists covering a presidential political event.
Egbe fighters attack Okunran village in retaliation for an earlier attack.
Gunmen abduct the wife of Delta State Commissioner for Basic Education, Prof. Patrick Muoboghare.
Gunmen attack a predominantly Christian village, killing ten people and injuring four others.
Employees of a college gather to protest the alleged moves by the Imo State government to forcefully confiscate some portions of land at the Nworie and Shell Camp end of the institution's premises.
Government workers protest and threaten a strike if their payment demands are not met.
Ethnic farming militias clash, 15 reported dead.
A journalist is kidnapped near his house and held for N10 million ransom, but escaped is captors a few days later.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen shot and wound two police officers.

column7: LCDA: Ejigbo Local Council Development Area
column17: A group of youths demonstrate outside the offices of a construction company in protest of the suspension of road construction in the area.
Gunmen kidnap a journalist in the Delta region.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen blow up a remote bank with a homemade bomb. Later, the group was chased to northern Kano State where nine died in a shootout with police.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following a five hour gunfight security forces shot dead nine gunmen believed to be involved in several previous attacks.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Boko Haram school bomb kills two civilians, including an Islamic scholar.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A gun battle kills five suspected Boko Haram members.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: During a military raid on their Kano hideout members of Boko Haram detonate a car bomb in defense, killing two sect members and injuring two soldiers.
Ethnic clash in a Makurdi suburb. Police arrest 63.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gun battles renew into Sunday, three police and three sect members killed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces launch a pre-dawn operation on a Boko Haram hideout. There were an """"undisclosed"""" number of rebel deaths.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram killed two civilians.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Police conduct a house-to-house search for Boko Haram members, kill four in a gun battle. The group was wanted for suspected for involvement for killing a prison official and a retired inspector of police.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram bombs a police station and a military headquarters in Damagum, four police killed.
Gunmen kidnap a medical doctor and demand ransom.
A military task forces shoots and kills four youths who attacked them for unknown reasons.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A group of Boko Haram members attack a local police station. Four killed in their effort.
Security forces kill 11 Boko Haram members (actor not confirmed) over a shootout near a bomb factory that lasted two days. One soldier and one police member were also killed.
Rioters went on a rampage in central Nigeria and burnt down a police station to protest the detention of their friends.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Police arrest 33 members of Boko Haram near the state capital, though Boko Haram denies this occurred.
A battle between Boko Haram (actor not confirmed) and security forces enters its second day.
Gunmen attacked a police station. Security forces were successful in killing one of the attackers.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a local government official at his home.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide bomber injures two.
Oyo youths protest calling for the closure of the Federal Polytechnic in the town until further notice.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A police officer is killed by Boko Haram in the Barkin Ladi area.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A security detail kills two members of Boko Haram in a shootout. A senior police officer is killed else ware in the city in a separate event.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two civilians are killed by Boko Haram in the Panshekara neighbourhood and another in a separate location near Zaria road.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two members of Boko Haram are killed in an internal dispute.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three members of Boko Haram are killed when they arose suspicion at a checkpoint.
Court officials and police attack reports covering a case. Witnesses called it a ""vicious assault.""

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen kill seven civilian traders at a market.
Unknown gunmen shoot and kill two soldiers near a military base.
A Spanish national is kidnapped by unknown gunmen. He is a medical doctor.
Gunmen kill three police.
A vigilante mob nearly killed a man they believed to be a kidnapper.
Police uncover numerous heavy weapons on two separate raids in Gombe.
Students protest over the suspension of four courses in a popular department. Police shut down the university indefinitely and order the premises vacated to restore order.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram detonates two explosives outside a church during Easter services, 41 dead, many others hurt.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A security team in pursuit of those involved in an attack on a market on March 4th kill three and arrest others.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram (believed) detonates a bomb in central Jos, but caused no death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attackers kill a civilian, a politician and a police officer before being shot and killed by the military.
A gang, suspected to be members of a rival political party attacked members of the Labour Party in a park. Six injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill a young girl and three others.
Oyo youths protest calling for the closure of the Federal Polytechnic in the town until further notice. The group protested for a similar end the previous week.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Islamist group Boko Haram have killed at least five people and burnt immigration offices in a Nigerian town on the border with Cameroon.
About 20 persons were injured and several shops vandalized in Apata area of Ibadan, Oyo State, when members of the Oodua Peoples Congress (OPC) clashed with some hoodlums.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The JTF foils a bomb attack when they find a series of large undetonated ordinances.
State employed doctors begain a protest and strike for unknown reasons.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram shoots and kills ten civilians at a border town with Cameroon.
Defusal: Police discover a large cache of undetonated bombs in Kano.

column6: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
column17: Property destruction: MEND attacks an oil facility, later takes credit.
Gunmen attack a market, a customs official is killed.
Unknown gunmen attack a police station, shoot an officer. It is unclear if the officer died, or is injured.

Gunmen, presumed to be the same group that yesterday attacked a market, torched two schools. So far 14 schools have been burnt down by Boko Haram, 7,000 children affected - enrollment down 28% in Borno State.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram spokesman, Abu Qaqa II, is killed in an internal Boko Haram struggle. Exact date and place (likely in Borno State) of the event are unknown.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A JTF task force raids a Boko Haram hideout, kills four and makes 13 arrests.
The government of Nigeria announces they have opened a Boko Haram interrogation and detention center in Lagos.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack customers of a bakery, five dead. Police kill one sect member was he tried to escape. This happened in the Polo neighbourhood of the city.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A photographer at Sharada Kwanar Ganduje area in Kano was shot dead by unidentified gunmen, suspected to be members of the Boko Haram militants.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Spanish doctor who was kidnapped on April 4th is released unharmed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian Forces have shot dead two suspected Boko Haram members who allegedly attacked and killed five bakery workers last week.
Scores of Nekede community youths in Owerri-West Local Council protested over alleged plan by some persons to enthrone an unpopular monarch in their area.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: During a JTF raid on a Boko Haram bomb factory a explosive is inadvertently detonated, killing five BH suspects.
Students at the University of Ibadan begin a two day protest against the poor infrastructure of the schools buildings. Police respond by closing the university in April 24th.
A police officer shoot and kills a youth leader in a Benin suburb for unknown reasons.
A police officer kills a man in an unprovoked attack.
Day two of the university of Ibadan protest.
Three people are shot and set ablaze in their automobile. The motivation for the attack, as well as the attackers are unknown.
Four alleged kidnap suspects were killed by officers and men of the Anambra State Police Command during a shoot out at Ihiala Council area of the state. Tree arrested.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram is blamed for an attack on a bar that killed five, including a politician.
Members of a youth front disrupted traffic to protest the possibility of the governments fuel subsidy ending.
Before the House of Representatives began its debate on the report of the fuel subsidy probe yesterday, a group of youths stormed the National Assembly Complex protesting against debate.
Five killed, many injured in a midnight attack on a Plateau town. Unknown assailants.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Police arrest a suspected Boko Haram suicide before he was to carry out his objective on a Methodist church.
Five civilians are killed in an attack on a small village near Jos.
A bomb explodes at a sports bar in a Christian suburb of the city, one killed, nine injured.
Attackers attack two police stations, causalities uncertain. It is unclear if the attackers were Boko Haram or armed robbers.
Unknown gunmen shot dead six villagers in an overnight attack on Rim, 50km (30 miles) south of Jos in Plateau state. The attack was believed to have been fueled by communal or ethnic disagreements.
Three persons have been killed in fresh hostilities between Nsadop and Boje communities in Boki Local Government Area of Cross River State.
A bomb positioned outside army bases commissary explodes, but there were no reported injuries.
Armed attackers, believed to be the same group as those in the same town a day before, attack a bank. Police suspect Boko Haram, but the group could be a band of robbers.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram launched an attack on the home of a retired civil servant, five dead. Police respond and kill two of the assailants.
Five civilians are killed in a night attack on a village.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following two morning attacks a third is detonated in the Ungwan Muazu area of the state. Two injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suicide bombers in the Nigerian capital Abuja detonated their ordinance in a newspaper office. 37 killed, 100 injured. Conflicting reports on the number of deaths, many have the number as low a 10. Boko Haram later claimed responsibility, threatening further attacks on media offices around the country.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide bomber hits a second newspaper officer in Kaduna, three killed. The two blasts came minutes apart. A third blast came two hours later and killed four more civilians.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram launched an attack on a beer parlour killing five and injuring six others.

Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two and injured three in two separate towns in the same area. One of the attacks was on the residence of a chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), but it is unclear if this is simply a coincidence.

Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two and injured three in two separate towns in the same area. One of the attacks was on the residence of a chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), but it is unclear if this is simply a coincidence.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen open fire on a Sunday church service and kill four worshippers.
Unknown gunmen shoot and the local police superintendent.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A bomb and gun attack on a theatre used for Sunday church services at a university has left at least 19 people dead.
An explosion targets a police station and a government office. Eleven killed, some reported injuries. Conflicting report claims five dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram shoot and kill four traders in Yobe State.
Fulani herdsmen (Muslim) attacked a Christian village near Jos, killing six and leaving others homeless.
The NLC hold a May Day protest against the proposed ending of a government oil subsidy.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack cattle trading market for the second time in a week. At least 50 reported dead, but the number was expected to climb.
Students at a university protest merger plans.
Electricity workers hold an indefinite strike and demonstrate in protest over pay.
Gunmen wearing military uniforms arrest five villagers and execute them.
A journalists home is attacked after an unfavorable article is published. The assailants are unknown, but the victim is certain it was not Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen believed to be from radical Islamist sect kill 2 guards in a prison break, free 23 prisoners.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack police guards at a wedding party, kill three attendees. Later in the day there was a bomb blast that injured four women and two children in the same area.
Residents and traders protested the 'stop and search' exercise being conducted by soldiers on motorists at strategic locations.
Police engage in a four hour gunfight with unknowns, possible Boko Haram. Nine gunmen killed.
Five are abducted by gunmen in Taraba State, are taken to an adjacent village in Benue State and shot.
Police discover three unexploded bombs placed on the grounds of the same university that suffered an attack weeks ago. When the police detonated the bombs four were injured.
Gunmen, possibly Boko Harm attack a police station, kill two officers and escape. 13 were later arrested.
Some youths stormed the Zaria Police Station to protest the alleged killing of one Abdullahi Nura by a middle age man, over a N250 snatched from a girl.
Unidentified gunmen attack a village, injure one.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three people were on Sunday night killed when gunmen opened fire on residents of Tukuntawa area of Kano.
Gunmen engaged in the two hour gun battle with police, four police dead.
Fulani gunmen launch attacks on four villages around the Lamurde vicinity. Al least twelve killed.
An ACN protest turns ugly when supporters begin beating each other for unknown reasons. One reported dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Attacks in north-east Nigeria believed to have been carried out by radical Islamist sect Boko Haram killed at least seven police officers. The attack also struck the home of a former senator.
Journalists in a restive state in central Nigeria said Monday they would halt coverage of government activities in protest at the failure of the authorities to stop years of deadly violence.

A group of 500 indigenes of Anambra State who were sacked by the Abia State government protested at the Government House, Awka, lamenting the death of their 19 former colleagues who were also disengaged.
Two gunmen shot and killed a retired technical engineer at his home. Unknown motive.

Hundreds of artisans and market women staged a peaceful protest asking President Goodluck Jonathan to implement the recommendation of the National Judicial Commission (NJC) that Justice Ayo Salami should be re-instated as Appeal Court President.

Pupils of Ifelodun Grammar School, Kiloru, were rusticated for carrying out a protest against the trial of an Osun State monarch, Oba Adebukola Alli, Alowa of Ilowa. Oba Adebukola Alli, has been standing trial for allegedly raping a female National Youth Service Corps member, sometime last year.

The senatorial office of a National Assembly member, Sen. Gbenga Obadara in Abeokuta was vandalized by irate, rioting supporters of the ruling Action Congress of Nigeria (ACN) over alleged plan by the powers that be to impose chairmanship candidate on them.

A bus explosion rocked an area of the Nigerian oil hub city of Port Harcourt on Thursday, a military spokesman said, but the cause and extent of damage remained unclear, though a school is believed to have been destroyed. Boko Haram suspected. Two killed, others injured.
Nigerian youth of the Arewa Defense League accuse government of destabilizing northern region for electoral purposes.
A pair of explosions rock a school. Following, two other unexploded bombs found by police.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A local political official receives several threats via text message from a militant group, suspected to be Boko Haram. The messages were alerting the officials of plans to bomb the police station in the town, the Otukpo Main Market and St Marys Church, among others.
Fulani militia men attacked and killed 10 in an apparent ethnically motivated attack. The group attacked Tyoughatee Village for three hours.
Two policemen were shot dead and one injured at Ahoada end of the East-West Road, Rivers State, by unknown gunmen.

One person was killed while four others sustained gun injuries when armed robbers in the early hours of yesterday attacked the chief of Jaba (Kpop Ham) in Jaba local government area of Kaduna State, Dr Danladi Gyet Maude, at Gitata village along Kwoi-Keffi road.
Gunmen on Monday assassinated a Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), Mr Emmanuel Ochiobi, attached to the Central Police Station, Onitsha in Anambra.

Violence has continued to rage in the northern part of the country as two suspected gunmen on a tricycle on Monday attacked the residence of a police officer, Adamu Oshe, shooting him dead inside his car in Pawari Ward of Damaturu, Yobe State.
Gunmen kill a police officer.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An explosive thrown by suspected members of Islamist Boko Haram sect on at patrolling soldiers damaged some houses in a city.
One person was reportedly killed and another critically wounded in a clash involving two cult groups at Osun State Polytechnic, Ire. The two groups are unknown.

An unknown group assaulted a chieftain of the Action Congress of Nigeria (ACN) in Akure South Local Government Area of Ondo State, Samuel Ademoyegun. Ademoyegun was allegedly attacked around 8.00pm after he left his residence at Oke-odu on the outskirts of Akure.
A gunfight between police and unknown attackers in Nigerias restive north on left one officer and a civilian dead.
Police beat a man to death over a traffic violation.
Lorry drivers and other motorists yesterday blocked the Kaduna-Zaria express road over alleged harassment by soldiers manning a check point at a junction leading to the Leprosy Centre in Zaria.

Three people were killed at the Benue State University, (BSU) in Makurdi when an unknown ethnic militia broke into a dormitory and attacked its inhabitants. The attack is suspected to be a reprisal for an earlier attack.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen shot dead four card players in the northern Nigerian city of Kano. Motivation unknown.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen killed a Muslim cleric and a retired prison guard on Saturday in northeastern Nigeria, residents and a medic said, amid a wave of such killings blamed on Islamist group Boko Haram.

Two gunmen attacked the Potiskum Timber Market in Yobe State yesterday at about 1.30pm. The attack led to the death of two persons, while a 10-year-old-child sustained thigh injury as a result of a stray bullet.

Youths in the Niger Delta at the weekend protested what they called slow pace of work on the dualisation of the East-West road (Warri-Port Harcourt) and lack of infrastructure in the region. Protesters gathered in two towns in the region.

Youths in the Niger Delta at the weekend protested what they called slow pace of work on the building of the East-West road (Warri-Port Harcourt) and lack of infrastructure in the region. Protesters gathered in two towns in the region.
Gunmen shoot and kill a Islamic cleric. The gunmen are suspected to either be the same group or from the same organization as the shooters in Potiskum.
Five gunmen on motorcycles assassinate a chair of local government.

Borno Police Command has disclosed that a Police Sergeant, Malam Lawan and a traffic warden attached to the Bama Road Traffic Unit were on Sunday shot and killed by gunmen at their respective residences in Gomari and Lamisula wards of Maiduguri.
An Igbo trader is shot and killed at his home.

Gunmen opened fire on Muslim worshippers outside the home of a controversial cleric in Nigeria on Sunday, killing at least one person and wounding others. Boko Haram is suspected as the cleric had recently been critical of the group.
An Italian expatriate is kidnapped by unknown persons.
Following the killing of four Igbo traders by unknown gunmen, Igbo people in Yola refuse to open their shops in protest.
Gunmen on a motorcycle shot dead six traders from the mainly Christian Igbo ethnic group in northeastern Nigeria. Boko Haram are active in the area, though it is unclear who is behind these attacks.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Armed bandits suspected to be members of radical Islamic sect Boko Haram killed 10 people as they attacked a bakery on the outskirts of Maiduguri town in Nigeria today, witnesses said. Residents say the attackers came in the wee hours of the morning and killed mostly Christian workers of the bakery, then took an unknown amount of money as they left.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two civilians are killed by suspected Boko Haram at Abaganaram market.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three are killed in a hotel bar at the hands of suspected Boko Haram.

Nigerian police fired tear gas on Friday in a bid to disperse student protesters demonstrating over a name change at their university, authorities and witnesses said. Students respond by throwing stones at police and physically engaging them. On Wednesday students protesting the name change blocked a bridge elsewhere in the city.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A German, Raupach Edgar, and four others were killed in Kano, during a shootout between military men of the Joint Task Force (JTF) and the dreaded sect, Boko Haram.
A prominent doctor is kidnapped by unknown men, later released.
Following a Boko Haram suicide bombing, military forces allegedly shoot and kill eight bombing victims and wound others in an apparent effort to restore law and order in the blast area.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At people were killed and 40 or more injured when a suicide bomber attacked a church. Boko Haram claimed responsibility in the days that followed. Conflicting accounts have the death toll at nine and injured number at 35, while others have the toll at three.

Two improvised explosive devices planted under a mango tree behind C block, Naraguta male hostel of the University of Jos, went off on Sunday night while a third explosive connected to the other two was successfully detonated by members of the police anti bomb squad. No report of injury.
A priest is found dead near his church. It is unknown who the perpetrator is or their motive.

column8: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: A combined team of the police, army and other security operatives killed about 16 members of the Movement for the Actualization of the Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB) and injured 83 others as they raided the offices of the group in the commercial city of Onitsha, Anambra State. The raid lasted two days.

There was pandemonium in the Mushin area of Lagos on Monday evening as men suspected to be members of the Odua peoples Congress and some Hausa youths in the area clashed. No deaths, but many injuries sustained.
Students of the University of Port Harcourt (UNIPORT) Part-time programme staged a peaceful protest over an increase in their school fees from N48,000 to N105,000.

column8: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Day two of a MOSSOB raid. One killed on day two.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Forces shot dead 16 militants in a fire fight with Islamist sect Boko Haram. A Reuters reporter heard gunfire and explosions echoing through the remote city of Maiduguri.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to belong to Boko Haram opened fire and killed a retired deputy inspector-general of Nigeria's federal police, as well as two other officers in the city.
Unidentified kidnappers abduct a journalist near his home.

Property worth millions of naira were yesterday destroyed when youths from Ikenga Ogidi in Idemili North local government area of Anambra State took to the streets to protest alleged murder of 26-year-old man in the area whose name was given as Arinze Ajaekwu.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide car-bomber, widely believed to be involved in Boko Haram, hit the main gate of the Borno State Police Command Headquarters in Maiduguri, killing a Police inspector, a traffic warden and four other civilians, injuring 24 tricycles drivers and passengers commuting on the Airport Road when the blast occurred at 11.26am. Eight killed, 24 injured. Some reports have the death count seven, while others, eight. Earlier in the day another suicide bomber detonated himself near a school elsewhere in the city.
Families and friends of DANA Air crash victims protested delay in having bodies of their loved ones released for burial in front of a local mortuary.
Gunmen shot dead a police constable outside his home late in the day.
Medical students of Igbinedion University are reportedly abducted.

A suicide bomber blew up his car just outside the police headquarters in the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri, killing eight people and wounded 19 others. It is not clear of the victims were police or civilians.
Unidentified Gunmen shoot dead a police official who was visiting from out of town.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three Boko Haram gunmen enter a church and open fire on congregants. At least one dead.
Suspected ""cultists"" hacked a NSCDC (branch of military) to death with knives and machetes before one assailant was arrested by local police.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A man drove a bomb-laden car to the entrance of the Christ Chosen Church and detonated it. At least six deaths reported, including the bomber, 52 injured, but number may rise. Boko Haram later declared responsibility.
Following the suicide attack at a church, a large group of Christian youths protest, blocking a major road. Clashes with police began; five were reported dead, plus injures.
Federal Government College students claim gunmen attacked students outside off campus and injure several. Police deny these reports.

27 people, including one police officer are killed in an apparent revenge attack on a town. Many others injured. The attack began at 1am while most slept, gunmen going house to house killing residents in cold blood. Following the attack many of the remaining residents fled this and surrounding villages in fear of further attacks.
A traditional ruler escapes death when a group of unidentified gunmen attack him in an apparent assassination attempt.
Police battle suspected kidnappers, rescue two victims in two adjacent locations. One suspect killed in each location.
Police battle suspected kidnappers, rescue two victims in two adjacent locations. One suspect killed in each location.
Property destruction: A group of ""ex-militants"" attack an oil pipeline operated by a private corporation. Many militants believe these corporations are unjustly extracting the resource.
A group of pensioners, numbering over 100, gathered at the Federal Secretariat, Abuja, protested against alleged neglect by the Pension Reform Task Team.
During a protest of pensioners, members of Nigerian Immigration Services assaulted several journalists covering the protest.
A group of six gunmen driving in a bus with no plate number followed a lawmaker to his house and shot him dead. Assailants unknown, as well as the lawmakers political affiliation.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two policemen have been killed and three others wounded in an attack allegedly carried out by Boko Haram. The gunmen were able to flee the scene.
Following a ethnic clash outside of technical school the bodies of two are discovered by police.

All five Peoples Democratic Party governors boycotted the inauguration of the PDP's committee for the July 14 Edo State governorship election in Abuja. Included in their absence from the event were several PDP senators.
A politicians cousin is abducted by unidentified men. The group later demeans N50m for his release.
National Youth Service Corps members serving in Ekiti State in Ado Ekiti protested against the non-payment of their allowances by the state government.
Unknown men assaulted a journalist in the presence of police, who did nothing to help.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigeria's Joint Security Task Force (JTF) on killed four suspected militants and arrested seven others during a raid at Naibawa Kwanar Masallaci quarters in the West African country's northwestern state of Kano.

Aggrieved members of the Hausa community clashed with policemen, two killed in the brawl. An eyewitness said that the Hausa attacked the station to avenge the death of one their kinsmen. By the end of the clash the police station was destroyed by fire.
Six students are killed over the weekend by suspected cultists. No name or group given.
A PDP chief is kidnapped and later discovered murdered by unknown assailants.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Coordinated suicide blasts cause damage at a Christian church in Ungwan Baraawa. (Conflicting account: some reports claim there were only three churches bombed, which does not include this event).

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Coordinated suicide blasts cause damage at a Christian church in Nassarawa. (Conflicting account: some reports claim there were only three churches bombed, which does not include this event).
ex-Niger Delta militants (unnamed, could be MEND) clashed with suspected student cultists on Sunday, several injured.
Traders and customers at Artisan Market in Enugu on Sunday fled different directions when three men suspected to be cultists shot dead an unidentified man inside the market.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suicide bombers hit a churches during Sunday services, driving a explosive laden car into the building. Boko Haram claimed responsibility in the days that followed. Authorities in Kaduna State impose a 24 hour curfew following the violence. 23 dead, plus injuries. Some reports have the death toll as high as 40. 75 were killed in the total church bombings plus retaliation through rioting.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram (who later takes responsibility) suicide bombs two church during Sunday services. The blasts happened in the Wusasa and Sabon-Gari districts of Zaria. 22 believed dead.

Following several attacks on Christian churches, a large group of Christian youths retaliate in the Sabon Tasha and Trijania neighborhoods, kill 52 people with sticks and swords and destroy a mosque. 125 injuries believed.
Following several church bombings Christian mobs barricaded roads and attacked motorists who appeared to be Muslim.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four are dead in a Boko Haram Christian church bombing in a town known as Trikaniya.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram bombs Ekilisiya Yanuwaa Nigeria (EYN) Church, three worshipers killed, 54 injured.
Following a series of Boko Haram church blasts Christians are incensed, set up road blocks in suburban Kaduna.
Rioting violence erupted late in the day following Boko Haram attacks on Sunday. Much of the violence lasted until Tuesday.

Traders begin a protest march against some Chinese business men who they accused of undermining and killing their businesses. Speaking during the protest, the national Chairman of the association, Mr. Azubike Nwachukwu , said Nigerian dealers have been operating at a loss since the Chinese business men started retail selling of the leather products at a very cheap price.

Muslims fired AK-47 rifles, burned tires and destroyed at least one church in the northern city of Kaduna, two days after rioting by Christian youths killed 52 people. This is apparently a retaliatory action. Police arrested several involved. Some reports state there were 101 left dead after three days of violence in the effected towns.
Two rival cult groups clash in Calabar, causing deaths and destruction of property. Exact number of deaths unknown.
Gunfire and rioting rocked two northern Nigerian cities on Tuesday in a fresh round of unrest, prompting authorities to slap curfews on both after weekend violence killed 52 people.
Gunfire and rioting rocked two northern Nigerian cities on Tuesday in a fresh round of unrest, prompting authorities to slap curfews on both after weekend violence killed 52 people.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: There was gridlock on Tuesday in Ikorodu area of Lagos State after members of the National Union of Road Transport Workers blocked Ikorodu Road to protest against the seizure of their vehicles by the state's Task force on Environmental and Special Offences and Traffic Management Authority.

Osun State deputy governor, Titi-Laoye Tomori, was yesterday held hostage and booed by Action Congress of Nigeria (ACN) protesters who were not satisfied with the governments action to a particular cause. It should be noted the deputy governor is of the same party as the protesters.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Day two a Boko Haram attacks on Damaturu. Three police officers killed, four others injured.
Arrests: Police arrest 57 members of an ethnic cult group they believe are responsible for a recent murder and clash at a university.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Violence renews in Kano City, explosions and shootings at police vehicles are reported in the evening. At least three police officers killed when they are slain by their own stolen weapons.
Violence sparks between Muslims and Christian groups, five dead.
Defusal: Police discover an unexploded bomb near a village hall.
Security personnel kill nine members of a Christian militia who had been warring with a Muslim militia in Kaduna. The security groups was attempting to restore the peace.
Five are killed during a riot what was triggered after commerce between a Christian boy and a Muslim woman. The deaths have not been confirmed.

Arrests: 93 people suspected to be members of the two rival cult groups that have been terrorizing residents of Calabar in the last few days have been nabbed by police. The groups seem to be organized (unknown command structure), but are not named.
An explosion went off outside a nightclub in the Nigerian capital Abuja, breaking windows and damaging cars, but no casualties were reported.

Traffic was disrupted for several hours at the ever busy Onitsha -Owerri highway as students of the National Metallurgical Training Institute, NMTI, protested an alleged plan by the federal government to scrap the institution or merge it with another one yet to be named.
Kano State Police command on Friday arrested four persons for allegedly trying to plant a time bomb at Waje Friday mosque in Fagge Local Government Area of Kano

Abakaliki, the Ebonyi State capital, at the weekend, virtually came to a halt when over 50 women from Ivo Local Council stormed the city to vent their anger over the suspension on 'a trumped up charge of drunkenness and boarding a tricycle,' of the member representing their constituency in the House of Assembly, Princess Lillian Igwe.
A family of six including a six month old child and a 70-year old grandmother were murdered by Fulani gunmen at Kumpun village in Mangu Local Government Area of Plateau State.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Attackers with guns and explosives raided a jail in a restive Nigerian city on Sunday, leaving four Prison Guards dead and freeing 40 inmates. Boko Haram is blamed. The gunmen also attacked a school in the town.
Two large explosives are discovered in a residential area of Jos by residents. Police were able to recover the pair before they detonated.

An explosion near a cluster of bars in the northern Nigerian city of Bauchi, recently targeted by Boko Haram Islamists, has injured nine people. No group has claimed responsibility for this blast, but Boko Haram is suspected.
Gunmen attack a police post, no report of death of injury.

Gunmen with explosives attacked a police station on Tuesday in the northern Nigerian city of Kano, previously targeted by Islamist militant group Boko Haram. The clash lasted into a second day, resulting in the death of seventeen militants and one police officer.
Unidentified Gunmen attack a police station, two civilians, two insurgents killed. Several other police stations were attacked in the metro area in an apparent coordinated effort.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Day two of attacks on a police station by suspected Boko Haram. Seventeen militants and one police officer killed by the end of the battle. Several arrested.
Defusal: Explosives were found planted at a police station and filling station, but were detonated by a local bomb squad before they were able to cause damage.
Arrests: At least 147 persons have been arrested by the police in central north Nigerias Kaduna State for alleged involvement in reprisal attacks on churches across the state.
Gunmen have killed the Rivers State Chairman of the All Nigeria Peoples Party, Mr. Julius Nwaofu. He was shot several times after leaving the airport. Assailants unknown.
Fulani gunmen attacked and killed the local chief of the PDP, his wife and child.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram attack a police station and a bank in a small town. ""Many lives"" were said to have been lost in the attack.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Police say security forces have killed suspected sect members during a military raid on their hideout in a besieged city in Nigeria's northeast. The police were not clear with regard to the number of deceased.
Gunmen entered Kurna Asabe area of Kano metropolis and killed a former local government councilor, a woman and a teenager. The Politians political party was not mentioned.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunfire and explosions rocked the northeastern Nigerian city of Damaturu on Saturday as security forces launched a pre-emptive offensive against Boko Haram Islamists. The offensive followed intelligence that BH was planning to launch an attack on the city. The violence was most heavily concentrated in the Nyanya and Obasanjo Estates areas of the city.

An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded on under a bridge near a village in the Riyom Local Government of Plateau State, north-central Nigeria, just as the police detonated two more bombs planted in the same area, some 40 kilometers from Jos, the state capital. No word of causalities. Riyom has witnessed some bomb blasts and constant rifts between members of the Berom ethnic group and Fulani herdsmen, though there is no word who is responsible here.
Defusal: Following a tip, police discover a pair of bombs placed by unknown persons. The bomb squad detonated to bombs before they were able to cause damage.
Unidentified gunmen have shot and killed two people leaving one other person critically injured when the struck at Gwandu quarters of Shamaki ward in Gombe metropolis.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces shoot and kill three suspected Boko Haram members. One female was arrested.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attackers killed nine construction workers in the restive northeastern city of Maiduguri, the base of the Islamist sect.
An explosion that went off near a shopping mall in Nigerias capital causing one injury.

Members of the military gathered at the Gowon House headquarters of the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) in Abuja, seeking immediate redeployment from the northern states over fears of Boko Haram attacks.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected gunmen believed to be members of the Boko Haram sect attacked the Borno State Housing Corporation (BOHC) office complex in Maiduguri, killing its General Manager, Isa Madu Ngaram and an engineer.

Youths from the Hausa community clash with a group of Yoruba truck drivers who they believe killed a prostitute in their community. Three dead, 25 large trucks destroyed. This is a history of violence between these two groups.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces raid a Boko Haram hideout, kill one member of the sect.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack a Damaturu slum with explosives and firearms. Causalities and damage unknown.
Defusal: Police discover and detonate a pair of explosives in the Congo Russia neighborhood of the city. It is unknown who the perpetrators are, however, the police force publicly blamed Boko Haram.

Fulani militants (and/or Boko Haram) raid six villages in the Barakin Ladi region (villages either unincorporated or not named) and kill at least 63. Most of the victims were found at the home of a Christian pastor, where the large group was gathered for safety. More than 200 displaced among the villages.
Fulani militias attack the town on Kushen in the Barakin Ladi area. 15 reported dead.
Fulani militias attack a Christian village early n the morning before attacking others in the area. 8 reported dead.

Fulani militants (and/or Boko Haram) raid several villages in the Riyom government area causing numerous deaths. Specific villages were not named. 58 were killed among to two areas. More than 200 displaced among the villages.

Muslim Fulani herdsmen (and/or Boko Haram) raided several villages. Here, a cemetery in Barkin Ladis area known as Maseh, at least 22 were killed in a raid, including two politicians. Most of the victims are of the Christian Birom ethnic group. The group was at the cemetery to bury the victims of the previous days attacks in the area. More than 200 people displaced among the villages. Later the Fulanis blame the military for the attacks.

State security forces push back against Fulani attacks, causing a two hour battle. Two police and 21 assailants killed. 14 civilians were listed among the dead, though it is not clear if the civilian death was caused by this fighting or the original Fulani attacks.

Following Fulani attacks on Christian Birom villages, a mob of Birom and other Christian youths form to retaliate against members their attackers ethnic group or religion. Deaths caused, unclear number.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram attacked the residence of an Islamic cleric, Shehu of Borno, Alhaji Abubakar Umar Garbai El-Kanem, killing a resident of the palace as well as a trader in a nearby market.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram attack and kill an Islamic cleric, Sheikh Ibrahim Majimi, at his home.

Fulani militiamen attacked a Brigadier General when his staff was changing a flat tire in the car he was travelling in. The militia group may have purposely blown the tire to set up the assassination.
A women's group of 2,000 protest the planned demolition of their houses. Reports of police violence.
Unknown gunmen kill four, injure one.
Reports of two small villages attacked by unknown people in Plateau State. Over 140 dead. The military disputes this claim.
Reports of two small villages attacked by unknown people in Plateau State. Over 140 dead. The military disputes this claim.

Seven people wounded and many houses were destroyed when a neighboring community attacked another. The attack is believed to be motivated by the possession of land. The victims were of the Nkpor community.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide bomber kills 10 in a Mosque near the Shehus palace. The Shehu is the top Islamic leader in the state. Six others injured. The bomber was a teenage boy, whom security experts believe was involved with Boko Haram.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill a Divisional Police Officer for unknown reasons.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, attack a small town outside Kaduna, kill one.
A lynch mob attacks a suspected bike thief, kills him.
A bomb is detonated in a car outside a church during Sunday services, no causalities. Police arrest two suspects following the incident, who are believed to be involved in Boko Haram (not confirmed).

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Heavy gunfire reported in the Yobe State capital. Suspected Boko Haram members raid a police station. The organization later claims credit for the attack.
Defusal: Police forces discover and raid a bomb factory in a church.

column8: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Members of the Onitsha Communal Militia attack two members of MASSOB, injuring them. The two were attacked for allegedly preventing them from collecting illegal levies from Onitsha traders.
An explosion outside a government building kills at least one. It is unknown is perpetrated the incident, though it is believed to be either Boko Haram or a Fulani group.
When a grenade is thrown at a Islamic school in a Jos suburb security agents respond with gunfire. One small boy was killed by the blast.
the National Union of Electricity Employees (NUEE) begin a multi-day protest of a Nigerian electrical companies merger with a Canadian counterpart.
One s dead after Fulani herdsmen clash with area natives over the alleged destruction of farming crops.
Non-violent activity: Hotel staff discover an unexploded bomb.
A group of soldiers attacked a group of police with rocks and bottles after soldiers witnessed a police officer accosting the driver of a bus whom they believed was interrupting the flow of traffic.
Two communities protest a proposed merger into a new state fearing neglect by newly formed government.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a JTF team along a road. Unknown causalities.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six are dead, including a police constable when gunmen on motorcycles attack a market area. Boko Haram is widely believed to be responsible.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be linked to Boko Haram attack a radio station and kill three. Sharada is a Kano neighbourhood south east of the downtown area.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Youths of the MASSOB violently take over portions of a State Park, injuring 16 and causing damage.
Members of the National Youth Service Corps protested the non-payment of allowances by the government.
Defusal: Police forces discover explosives outside a Catholic school in the capital and dispose of it before it is able to detonate.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be of Boko Haram, target Ibo Christians in an open air market and kill four.
During the planned demolition of a shanty town a police officer shot and killed an evicted resident and community leader.
Suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked the villages of Kai, Nyongon, Kachim, Kuffan, Begduk and Yokhol (all unincorporated) in Gashish District. There were no causalities.
A group of youths began throwing stones and other objects at an election official, accuse him of manipulating the voting process.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram kills a 10-yesr-old boy and wounds 10 others. The explosion occurred in the city's Tundunwadan Dan-iya area, a nightlife and pub district, a common target of Boko Haram, who later claimed credit for the blast.

Unidentified gunmen shot dead a Health Ministry worker after he was followed. The reasons for the killing are unknown. Witnesses claim the assailants did not leave the scene of the crime until they knew the victim was dead.

column8: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: A gunman attacks a regional leader of MASSOB, but the leader escapes unharmed. It is unclear if this was an assassination attempt or a robbery.
A prominent Christian leader is killed, his wife abducted, after unidentified gunmen storm their church.

A group of women barricaded a Shell petroleum facility in an event that lasted four hours. The group believed the company had not met their obligations to provide community amenities. The protesters also accused the company of environmental and social negligence.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following the killing of two Indians, members of Boko Haram attacked a police station in a separate attack in a different area of the city. Two police and civilian shot dead in the attack.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Armed men of the Boko Haram sect attacked a police station, set it ablaze. It is suspected these are the same gunmen involved in the attack in rural Bauchi State

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Indian nationals are killed in a suspected Boko Haram attack on their factory. Other were injured.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack a police station. Three police reported killed.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Shortly after Boko Haram killed two Indian nationals in a factory, the JTF makes 26 BH arrests and kills two in a raid.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On motorcycles, suspected Boko Haram assassinate a senior member of the police forces while he ate at home. Three of the officers guests were also shot and killed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attackers opened fire on Mosque worshippers. Three of the gunmen were shot by police who were present to protest the worshipers, while a fourth was killed when the explosive device he was carrying went off prematurely. Conflicting reports have the death count at five.
The traditional ruler of an area is kidnapped by unknown men, later released.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Motorcycle gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, opened fire on the car of a senior Nigerian air force officer Sunday, killing the driver and an aide (both junior air force officers), but the senior officer was not inside the vehicle at the time. Two pedestrians were collateral damage.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen on motorcycles attacked the country home of the Nigerian Vice President. The Vice President was not in the residence at the time, though one civilian was killed. Boko Haram later claimed credit for the attack. Two of the three perpetrators arrested.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Explosions, including a suicide blast, rocked two police stations in Nigeria's northwestern city of Sokoto. Boko Haram later claims credit. Six killed, including civilians, 30 others injured. Other reports have the death count at four, others three.
Defusal: Police discover and dispose of a explosive found at a school. Boko Haram is suspected, but there is no evidence to support the claim.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian troops kill two members of Boko Haram new the country's border with Chad. The alleged insurgents were caught carrying rocket-propelled grenades, Kalashnikov rifles as well as other assorted ammunition and weaponry.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a second police station into another area of the city, in an apparent coordinated attack.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram simultaneously attacked two police stations in Gombe. ""They threw explosives and opened fire on the police post in central Gombe. Some of the policeman were inside while others were outside. The explosions were followed by gunfire. There was a shootout between the gunmen and policemen which lasted till 10 pm (2100 GMT),"" a witness said. ""There were a lot of gunshots lasting for more than an hour. I cannot say if anybody was hurt or killed in the attack,"" he continued.
Non-violent activity: Members of the Ogoni ethnic group declare their independence from Nigeria, calling on the UN to recognize them as a nation.
Report of a bomb explosion at a church. However, conflicting accounts report no explosion at all.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Muslim leader escaped a suicide attack in a mosque by suspected Boko Haram, who later claimed credit . ""The bomber, however, detonated the explosives and blew himself off, injuring two policemen and three civilians in the process,"" a local official said.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a third neighbourhood in Maiduguri.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a second neighbourhood in Maiduguri.
Military forces raided a Boko Haram bomb factory in Kaduna.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a oil vessel off the coast of Nigeria, killing two sailors and kidnapping four others. The victims were not citizens of Nigeria. Following the event the Nigerian military launched efforts to recover the victims.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram detonated explosions in three neighbourhoods in Maiduguri. Following the violence soldiers went door-to-door arresting suspects. Some residents report unneeded violence at the hands of the soldiers. No reported death or injury.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide bomber rammed his car into a military patrol in the northeastern Nigerian city of Damaturu, killing himself, six soldiers, and two civilians. Boko Haram was suspected and later claimed responsibility. Nine other were hospitalized.
Hundreds of Ogoni ethnics took to the streets at Ogale-Eleme, Rivers State to protest the non-implementation of a UN potable water campaign.
Rival ""cult"" groups clash over the course of two days, causing at least tow deaths and other injuries.
Suspected Boko Hara(actor not confrimed) m opens fire on a crowded church during an evening service, at least 19 dead. Unknown injury number.

column7: Anambra, Enugu and Ebonyi Drivers Welfare Association
column17: A confederation of bus drives protested the government imposition of a tax.

A commercial motorcyclist, popularly called okada rider was stabbed in the stomach by two hoodlums suspected to be Fulani herdsmen on the long bridge end of the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway. The attack did not appear to be criminal.
Relatives of fallen police officers gather at police headquarters to protest the non-payment of pensions. Witnesses believe they numbered in the 1,000s.
Day two of rival cult clash.
Communal violence has occurred in Benue State with 10 persons killed and property worth millions of naira destroyed in Ojantele and Ijegwu communities in Otukpo and Obi local council areas.
Communal violence has occurred in Benue State with 10 persons killed and property worth millions of naira destroyed in Ojantele and Ijegwu communities in Otukpo and Obi local council areas.

Unknown assailants opened fire on a group of soldiers on patrol, sparking an exchange of fire that left two soldiers and two of the gunmen dead. It is unclear if the perpetrators have any connection to the church attackers the previous night.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram kill two police officers along a rural road.

Members and adherents of the BSDF declare their independence from Nigeria, believing the land of southeast Cross River State rightfully belongs to Cameroon. Upen their declaration the group launched a radio station.

Over 40 lawyers in Asaba, the Delta state capital on Friday barricaded magistrates' courts to protest the abduction of a newly appointed judge, Justice Marcel Okoh. The lawyers, who gathered under the auspices of the Nigerian Bar Association, marched through some streets of the state capital to the courts and said no court would be allowed to sit until Okoh is released.
Weapons Seizure: A team of the JTF raided a Boko Haram hideout, recovered weapons.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram kill one member of a security forces and wound two others in a ""militant attack.""
Unidentified gunmen attack a church, set it ablaze. Injuries, one death reported.
Weapons Seizure: Security forces raid a suspected Boko Haram hideout and recover a large cache of weapons.

column7: CNPP: Conference of Nigerian Registered Political Parties
column17: Adherents to the CNPP protest a local election, believing it was fixed.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A JTF raid on two Boko Haram hideouts results in the death of two militants and the arrest of 30 others. Panicked residents flee the city in large numbers.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Joint Task Force (military force) killed 20 suspected Boko Haram members in a shootout as they raided their hideout in Maiduguri. Conflicting report: some accounts have this event occurring on the 13th of the month.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be members of Boko Haram attack a church in Gombe.
A physically challenged group protests neglect by the state government by barricading a road outside the capital city.

The Joint Research and Allied Institutions Sector Union on Monday in Enugu embarked on a demonstration to protest the Federal Government's perceived failure to implement the agreement to improve the welfare of its members.
A gang known as the Area Boys attacks a journalist.
Six unidentified men attack journalists on a train.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three people were killed in a bomb blast on a northern Nigerian road leading to a mosque where a cleric had condemned the Islamist militant group Boko Haram. The ordinance was delivered on motorcycle.

Two suspected suicide bombers were killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) while another person suspected to be a member of the group escaped with injuries. Their bomb was concealed in a camera case. The assailants were unknown, but it is likely they were members of Boko Haram. Some reports have the death count at three.
Local traders protested the demolition of their shops and structures by the State Government.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces battle Boko Haram when they raid their hideout. 30 arrested.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A gun duel between Boko Haram and JTF security forces lasts two hours. One militant death reported, one soldier injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and a civilian while wounding three others in an attack targeting a military vehicle. The members of the military were not harmed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, attack a mosque and shot dead a member of the Borno Emirate Traditional Council (BETC), Zanna Kaselama.
The NUJ holds a protest demonstration against recent violence on journalists. The demonstration was held in part in front of the governors home.
During a Muslim celebration festival unknown persons bomb a police station. The blast injured one person and destroyed property.
Hundreds evacuate a downtown building after a bomb scare.

Violence broke out at the Rivers State University of Science and Technology (RSUST) as ""hoodlums"" attacked officials of the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) opposed to the appointment of an acting vice chancellor.
Two students are dead after an attack by Fulani Herdsmen on their village. Reports of women raped and houses burnt.

Protesters threatening violence stormed the premises of the State Oil Commission expressing grievances over alleged neglect by the commission. The group, mostly youths, armed with weapons, caused employees to flee.
An unidentified gunman is killed after a three hour gun battle with police.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: After a suspected Boko Haram attack in their neighbourhood, a group of Christian youths seek revenge on their attackers. Police we able to foil most of the violence.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A policeman was reportedly injured when suspected Boko Haram members fired at a military roadblock along Maiduguri Road, Kano, while the police stopped a violent confrontation between Boko Haram and some residents of the area. Many cars damaged.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram militants disrupt a Eid-el-Fitr celebration, no report of death or injury.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suspects attack a Christian church and a school. No report of injury or death. It is believed this group is the same group that attacked the police station elsewhere in the city.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suspects open fire on separate mosques, killing two.
Protesters gather after the state House Assembly did not swear in a recently elected official.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suspects attack a police station/prison and exchange gunfire. Reports of civilian injury or death, though numbers are unknown The gun battle lasted at least two hours according to witnesses.
Two suspected assassins are killed in a police gun battle. The two are believed to be in connection with the death of a British national.
Fulani militiamen raid a village and, kill two Christian residents.
Lecturers gather at a university to protest to demand the release of a kidnapped colleague, who was taken by unknown men for a large ransom.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen (suspected) shoot and kill a Irish national working for a construction firm.
Unidentified gunmen follow a police officer into a Mosque, kill him.
Unidentified gunmen invaded Okordia community in Yenagoa Local Government Area, Bayelsa State, and abducted a clan head, or traditional ruler at a local palace.
Unidentified gunmen abduct a government official.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A group of armed men, believed to be Boko Haram, shoot and kill a police officer during a gun battle.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber was killed as well as a passerby when his explosive detonated prematurely. The suspected target was members of the JTF.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram detonated an explosive in the Gwange area of the city late in the afternoon. Sporadic gunshots were reported in the area soon after. There was a explosion earlier in the day elsewhere in the city.
Protesters demand the removal of the Naval Chief of Staff for the naval detention of a man.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram attempt to bomb a JTF patrol, but the device exploded prematurely destroying nearby shops. Members of the JTF react with gunfire costing five members of BH their lives.
A group of pensioners gathered on the grounds of their former employer to protest non-payment.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A group of suspected Boko Haram ambushed a JTF patrol, though the counterattack killed all five attackers.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attacked a military checkpoint, kill an intelligence officer.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A JTF patrol is ambushed by members of Boko Haram. One officer was reported killed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six are shot dead by suspected Boko Haram. The event may have occurred on 2nd September.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram, weekend, stormed New Marte, Marte Local Government Area of Borno State, where they killed a Police Sergeant (names withheld), and two civilians. The group also burnt a police headquarters and a local church.
Weapons Seizure: A JTF raid on a suspected Boko Haram hideout recovers a large cache of weapons.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram kills a man in Ummarari Ward of the city.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram kills a man in Gwange Ward of the city.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram members detonated a bomb in the Sabon neighbourhood of Gombe. No causalities confirmed.
Unidentified men attempt to attack three police vehicles with explosives, but are unsuccessful.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A local government secretary of Bama Council area of Borno state, and his friend, a university lecturer were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram in the same area where six people were shot and killed by the same group on Saturday.
Unknown gunmen burnt the personal house of Damaturu local government PDP chairman Alhaji Audu
A group protests the planned destruction of a open-air market.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Men believed to be of Boko Haram attacked a home and killed four Igbos. It is unclear if the group was targeted because they were Igbos or if the attack was coincidental.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram carries out a series of coordinated attacked on telecommunications facilities in several areas. One is injured at this location, while several others ran for safety following the blast.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram carries out a series of coordinated attacked on telecommunications facilities in several areas. Two bombs failed to detonate in tow separate areas along Gombe road.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attacked two buildings housing the Ministry of Religious Affairs and the states Pilgrims Welfare Commission (YPWC) located on Potiskum Road. There was no official confirmation of the casualty figures but hospital sources claimed that 16 bodies were brought to the facility by the police and the JTF. The attacked carried into the early hours of the following day.
