column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Men on motorbikes, believed to be Boko Haram, destroyed MTN and Airtel mobile phone telecommunication masts during the early morning hours.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram set ablaze a telecommunications office in a coordinated effort to destroy much of the areas infrastructure. Sources revealed that the assailants, who were about 10 in number, stormed the telecommunications office around 2a.m. Wednesday and chased away the security men on duty before setting the building on fire.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack several telecommunication offices in a small geographic area. No report of injury or death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram continuers their attacks on telecommunication offices.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An attack on a JTF patrol results in a counterattack and the death of seven Boko Haram attackers. 13 others arrested.
A journalist for the Nigeria Guardian claims to have been attacked by police and security forces for taking photographs of a cabinet ministers car stuck in mud.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Military's Operation Restore Order shoots and kills seven suspected members of Boko Haram and arrested 13 others during a raid operation.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Harams attacks on telecommunication offices continue, many buildings in the area set ablaze.
Air Nigeria employees protest unpaid benefits at a major airport.
Unidentified gunmen disrupt a political meeting.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military officials kill seven suspected members of Boko Haram at a military checkpoint. 13 others arrested. No casualty was recorded on the part of the soldiers
House Assembly aides protest unpaid salaries. The group numbered in twenty.
Striking workers throw stones and raid the office of a university vice chancellor. The group was upset over the non-payment of allowances.
Employment of a university protest the non-payment of allowances.
Following a gunfight, the JTF arrested six suspects of a recent kidnapping of a university lecturer.
Local government workers in Ekiti State protested against non-implementation of the new minimum wage in local government areas.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the home of a member of the Federal House of Representatives (name withheld), killing a young boy in the process.
Ijaw youths attack a police station in violent protest over an attack by police on an ex-militant Ijaw commander earlier in the week.
Protests are held over the recent firing of Delta State Oil Producing Communities Development Commission (DESOPADEC) by the House of Assembly.
Employees of the states internal revenue service protest the non-payment of taxes by shop owners.

Following the end of Fridays Jumaat prayers, large groups of Muslims gather in Zololo Junction for an anti-American/Israeli protest, in the wake of violence in Libya and Egypt. In response, soldiers told the demonstrating youths to refrain and stop the demonstration and disperse. But the warning was not heeded, forcing the soldiers to shoot sporadically into the air to disperse them. Security forces added further security to the cities of Kano and Kaduna, anticipating further protests.
A group of 2,000 university students gathered to protest reported sexual harassment of female students by some staff of the school.
Residents of Iperu gather to protest the killing of a police officer in recent days.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen kill a security officer and three members of his family. Authorities believe Boko Haram is responsible.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected of belonging to the Boko Haram Islamist sect late Sunday shot dead at least six people who were playing ludo game in northern Nigerian city of Bauchi. Conflicting reports have the death total at 5.
Gunmen shot dead the acting Chairman of Maiha Local Government Council of Adamawa State, Lawan Datti. Reasons unknown.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Soldiers manning a checkpoint in northern Nigeria shot to death two ranking members of Boko Haram, including Abu Qaqa, a spokesman for the group.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Members of the JTF killed one member of Boko Haram and arrested two others. Following the shootout the JTF recovered 36 large explosives from a den. The deceased was later learned to be an official in the organization.
Unidentified persons kill four, injure nine and virtually destroy a small village in the early morning hours. It is possible the violence was driven by ethnic unrest.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A soldier and 13 members of suspected Boko Haram were killed during a shootout after an explosive was thrown into a military vehicle. Other reports have the death total at 10.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the justice commissioner, Zannah Malam, in a small town outside of Maiduguri.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Soldiers shoot and kill two suspected Boko Haram commanders on the outskirts of the city.

Hundreds of Bakassi youths gathered at the national assembly building to warn if nothing was done by the Federal Government before the October 10 deadline to reclaim the disputed oil-rich area, they would raise a terror group like Boko Haram in Cross River State.
Unidentified gunmen open fire on two police officers, killing them. along Afikpo Street

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen stormed a medical clinic, kill the medical directors son.

Thousands of Muslims, under the auspices of a pro-Iranian Shiite group, Islamic Movement, gather to burn US and Israeli flags and denouncing a US made anti-Islamic film, following the possible AQIM attack in Benghazi and other worldwide protests.
Four persons killed following a PDP inter party conflict over a candidate.

Youths of the surrounding communities of a oil flow station protest the companies handling of a recent oil spill in the area. After police maintain a presence near the protesters several of the youths engage the them with violence.
Shiite Muslims in the Nigerian town of Katsina burned U.S., French and Israeli flags and a religious leader called for protests to continue until the makers of the film and cartoons are punished.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: 32 suspected members of Boko Haram were arrested in a combined JTF/Police effort. The raids took place in several wards of the city over a six hour period.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The JTF conducted two separate Boko Haram raids in different parts of the city. Four dead, three arrested.
Tens of thousands protest in Kano against a anti-Islam US film. The group chanted """"death to America, death to Israel and death to the enemies of Islam"""".

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The JTF killed four and arrested three suspected members of Boko Haram during two separate raid operations throughout the city.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonates a car suicide car bomb outside a Catholic Church, at least three killed, plus the bomber, scores injured. Some reports have the death count as high as five.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian military kills 35 members of Boko Haram and makes sweeping arrests over two days in three neighbourhoods (not named) across the city.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The JTF raids a Boko Haram bomb factory, make 156 arrests of suspects, including a high profile leader of the group.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian military kills 35 members of Boko Haram and makes sweeping arrests over two days in three neighbourhoods (not named) across the city.
Thousands of Shiite Muslims gather to denounce the US, UK and Israel following waves of protests around the region. No incidents of violence reported.
Three protesting Lagos State University students are injured when police break up their demonstration against a delay in university payment.
One is killed when two armed men entered Lagos State University and opened fire on students. Two others injured.
Boko Haram (actir not confirmed) shoot and kill two police officers along a road.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four people are killed when suspected members of Boko Haram open fire on guests of a wedding. At least one reported injury.
University students riot over the killing of a fellow student by a hit-and-run driver. Much of campus property destroyed, including cars and animals of the agricultural department.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected detonate a suicide style bomb near an Islamic school causing unknown causalities, though injures have been widely reported.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security agents shot and killed two suspected members of Boko Haram as they attempted to carry out operations on a Christian church following an attack on an Islamic school in the same area.

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped the Delta State Commissioner for Higher Education, Prof. Hope Eghagha, assumedly for ransom. During the operation, his orderly, a police sergeant, was killed in the crossfire while his driver reportedly sustained serious injury.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to Boko Haram, opened fire in a student housing area near a polytechnic school in the northeastern Nigerian city of Mubi, killing at least 40 and injuring at least 15 others. In the following days the death count was raised to 48 and a curfew was imposed. It was later learned the gunmen personally knew their victims, specifically targeting Christians. The following week it was determined by authorities the perpetrators were in face Boko Haram. (Conflicting report: some sources have the attack occurring on 2 Oct, while other have the attack on 1 Oct, still others have differences in the causality count. )

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen shoot and kill 20 at a government housing complex before fleeing ion a boat in the Ngadabul River.
An unidentified man (unknown affiliation) detonates a bomb in a heavily populated area of the city, but causes no damage or harm. The individual was later arrested.
A traveler is attacked and nearly killed by ethnic Fulanis.
Fifty children, dressed in green and white colors, in Lagos staged a peace walk to advocate for violence against women and children, as well as their peace and safety.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two police officers. Boko Haram maintains a presence in the State, but they were not openly suspected here.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram detonate an explosive targeting military patrol, causing one death and four injuries.

Several groups, including ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities, NLC and the national socialist movement gathered to under the umbrella group JAF to protest Nigerias woes on the 52nd university of independence.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: JTF forces shoot and kill two suspects in connection to a shooting in a government housing complex which killed twenty.

Rival political groups clash following protests. It was reported that the AC was present, but its rival remained unnamed, though it is likely the PDP: Peoples Democratic Party. No injuries reported, though fighting lasted over half and hour.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: One person is dead and 10 others injured when a explosive detonates in a hotel/ Boko Haram is suspected.

Unidentified people attack a Labour Party campaign rally. LP leader publicly blame a rival, Action Congress, though this could be a political maneuver. Later in the week it was learned the attackers were cultists.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two University of Maiduguri students. Authorities are uncertain if it was the work of Boko Haram.

An explosion detonated by unknown persons causes seven causalities, which of whom were brought to a military hospital. Conflicting report: The depots Public Relations Officer, Capt. Ibrahim Abdullahi, told the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) in Zaria that no death was recorded in the incident.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram detonate an explosive at a beer garden. Three reported deaths, 12 injuries. Conflicting reports (Xinhua) have one killed, 11 injured.
A violent mob killed four university students who they believed were thieves. The victims were stripped naked, beaten with sticks, doused with petrol and set ablaze with tires around their necks.
A teachers union protested the cancellation of World Teachers Day by gathering the singing anti-government songs.
A explosion near a television station kills a woman and wounded five children. It is unclear who the perpetrators were.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen clash with JTF members in two separate areas of Damaturu. No deaths reports, several gunmen arrested.
Kwarbai Community Forum in Zaria Local Government Area of Kaduna State at the weekend protested over the arrest of its member and his family for allegedly involvement in Boko Harams activities.
Unknown gunmen have attacked Dogon Kuka village in Yobe State, killing 17. At least two victims died immediately. Authorities will not specify if they believe Boko Haram is a suspect.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen attack a small town market with firearms, killing three Chinese construction workers an a Nigeria aid.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: JTF members raid a Boko Haram hideout, kill 30, including a senior leader, second-in-command Bakaka, and arrest 11. Conflicting report: some sources claim 31 deaths and 10 arrests.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap the majority leader of the Benus State House assembly, Paul Biam (PDP), and release him 24 hours later. It is unclear if the motive for kidnap was political or criminal.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Mala Kaka, a traditional ruler outspoken against Boko Haram is shot and killed in his home.
A motorcycle delivery/taxi group protest the newly imposed restriction to certain roads.
A motorcycle delivery/taxi group protest the newly imposed restriction to certain roads.
Unidentified people attack a political headquarters of the PDP as factious members protest party policy.
Unidentified gunmen attack the official residence of an army commandant, killing at least one member of security personnel.

Nigerian soldiers angry about the killing of two soldiers in a Boko Haram blast, shot dead more than 30 civilians and seven soldiers in thoughtless rage. A witness saw that soldiers had set fire to about 50 homes and businesses around the area, which sits near the Nigerian Union of Journalists state office and other buildings in Maiduguri. It appeared the soldiers attacked the area using assault rifles and heavy machine guns mounted on armored personnel carriers. Rounds shot from the heavy machine guns destroyed cars and set roofs on fire, which razed buildings and caused damage at a two-story shopping complex. The military later denied the ever occurred.

Nigerian soldiers angry about the killing of two soldiers in a Boko Haram blast, shot dead more than 30 civilians and seven soldiers in thoughtless rage. A witness saw that soldiers had set fire to about 50 homes and businesses around the area, which sits near the Nigerian Union of Journalists state office and other buildings in Maiduguri. It appeared the soldiers attacked the area using assault rifles and heavy machine guns mounted on armored personnel carriers. Rounds shot from the heavy machine guns destroyed cars and set roofs on fire, which razed buildings and caused damage at a two-story shopping complex.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram (though they did not claim responsibility) detonate a remote controlled explosive near the local headquarters of the Nigeria Union of Journalists. Two passerby soldiers were wounded in the attack when their van drive over the device. Conflicting account: several local residents claim to see six dead taken away by medical units.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two policemen escorting immunization officials were shot dead today by gunmen on motorcycles at Kofar Dawanau area of Kano metropolis. It was later learned Boko Haram was responsible, and arrests were made.
Students of the University of Port Harcourt burn houses and cars in protest the recent killing riot and killing of four of their colleagues.
Two unidentified men assassinate a Enugu State monarch, or traditional ruler, at this shop. Police make several arrests in connection to the murder later in the week.
Three Christian Berom farmers are killed by Islamic Fulanis, adding to the ongoing ethnic strife.
Students block the entrance to state offices, preventing the governor and his deputy from entering. The group was protesting an alleged non-payment of their bursary allowances.
Residents of Ajeromi Ifelodun Local Council of Lagos State march to the headquarters of an electric company to protest a recent rate hike due to a recently imposed tax.

Unknown gunmen yesterday bombed a police station and Unity Bank branch in Gwaram town in Jigawa State with Improvised Explosive Devices (IED). Though the perpetrators were unidentified, Boko Haram has engaged in similar activities in the past.

Cross River lawmakers left the state house and went into the streets to protest the Federal Governments decision not to appeal the judgment of the International Court of Justice (ICJ) which ceded the oil-rich Bakassi Peninsula to the Republic of Cameroon. The protest march ended at the governors office with Governor Liyel Imoke appealing for calm.

Unidentified gunmen on motor bikes attacked a Federal Road Safety Commission (FRSC) patrol vehicle, killing two officers and injuring one seriously. The motivation for the violence was not speculated on.
Students gather to protest a rate and fee hike of the university. Police react to the demonstration with an increased presence, but to not engage the students.

A day following similar violence, a Fulani militia attacked Riyom Local Government Area of Plateau, 14 reported deaths. The attack may have been directed at Berom ethnic Christians, however this information is not clear. Conflicting information asserts 21 deaths over two days of attacks.
Hausa Muslims and Berom youths clashed over a disputed land where Muslims usually used for their praying ground during Islamic festivals. One person is allegedly killed.
A 75 year-old woman, along with her three children are killed by unknown gunmen. Fulani herdsman were later suspected, and several were arrested in connection with the murders.
Hundreds of residents of housing estate gather outside the National Assembly building to protest its planned demolition by the government.
Workers of the Electoral Commission protest the government over non-payment of wages.
Four are killed in three separate towns (names unknown or not provided) in a Riyom district over a continuing conflict. The death tool raised to 20 over the course of a week.
Members of the PDP hold a political rally in protest of internal factions of the party which they believe are working counter to the vision of the party.
Youths take to the streets to protest the killing of a man they believe was beaten by the police.

Unidentified gunmen kidnap the Rivers State Commissioner for Power, Mr. Augustine Nwokocha, along with his assistant. The perpetrators may have been pirates seeking ransom, witch is common in the area, though the facts are unclear.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A blast, seemingly targeting soldiers, detonates, but causes no causalities. Authorities believe the perpetrators are of Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four members of a family are killed as they exited a church. Boko Haram is suspected, though authorities cannot determine why this specific group was targeted.

Unknown assailants, disguised as police, attack a mosque in rural Kaduna, as well as the home of a local leader, killing at least 24 people in the pre dawn hours. Some believe the perpetrators were a local band of thieves seeking revenge, others, Boko Haram.
Nomadic Muslim herdsmen attacked a rural Christian village in central Nigeria over long-running land disputes, killing at least 30 people. The name of the village attacked is unknown or not provided.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 15 separate explosions in targeting JTF forces punctuated by gunfire echoed Monday across a Maiduguri city, leaving more than 10 persons dead and telecommunication masts burnt. The explosions started at about 5.15pm and was on intermittently for about 30 minutes and sending serious panic among the people, according to a witness. The violence affected three broad areas. Gunmen killed a ""traffic warden"" in this location.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: During a fire fight between Boko Haram and JTF forces 10 civilians are allegedly killed by Boko Haram in crossfire. Following the battle military command disputed this claim. Zannari areas of Lagos street
The police detonate an IED after it was discovered by a local opposite a motor park. There were no causalities reported.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Members of the JTF shoot and kill 24 suspected members of Boko Haram while repelling an attack. The militants launched their attacks from the homes of civilians late Monday night and a protracted fire fight carried into the following morning. Conflicting report: the Daily Trust claims the death count was 54. Zannari areas of Lagos street

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Witnesses said a gunman suspected to belong to Boko Haram shot dead a police traffic warden in the city within view of a military checkpoint. The gunman simply walked away after the attack unstopped, witnesses said.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 15 separate explosions in targeting JTF forces punctuated by gunfire echoed Monday across a Maiduguri city, leaving more than 10 persons dead and telecommunication masts burnt. The explosions started at about 5.15pm and was on intermittently for about 30 minutes and sending serious panic among the people, according to a witness. The violence affected three broad areas.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 15 separate explosions in targeting JTF forces punctuated by gunfire echoed Monday across a Maiduguri city, leaving more than 10 persons dead and telecommunication masts burnt. The explosions started at about 5.15pm and was on intermittently for about 30 minutes and sending serious panic among the people, according to a witness. The violence affected three broad areas.
Classmates of a murdered student protest against the violence, throw stones at police when they attempt to disperse the crowd.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two of a fire fight that killed 24 suspected members of Boko Haram. Zannari areas of Lagos street
Students at the Osun State College of Education riot in protest of two colleagues killed in a car accident. Fifteen injured, vehicles vandalized.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A bomb targeting soldiers is detonated by Boko Haram. 24 killed in the explosion, soldiers retaliated against local civilians following the attack.
About 2,000 block traffic in protest of a stone quarry company, which they believe have not paid agreed upon royalties to the town.
Multiple explosions targeting JTF forces in a market cause injury, but no death. Perpetrators unknown.
Following a Boko Haram bomb attack against them, soldiers retaliated against civilians. Four houses burnt and witnesses heard gunshots.
A bomb detonates in a industrial area, no injury reported.
An explosion damages a church building, no reported causalities.
Fulani herdsmen have attacked a bus killing four people in Gwatukuru village near Dass Local Government Area in Bauchi State. Nine injured.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack a suspected security checkpoint. Two soldiers sustain injuries.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Multiple explosions occur throughout the city for the second straight day, detonated by suspected Boko Haram. A military source said some buildings had been destroyed by homemade bombs and a security checkpoint was attacked, death toll stands at 11.
The bloody clash between Fulani herdsmen and Eggon farmers in Kadarko Community in Nasarawa State, has left three people dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram detonates an IED outside a church at 11am. Four killed in the attack, three injured. Hundreds of residents flee the city following the three days of attacks.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Chinese construction worker and three Nigerian civilians are shot and killed by suspected Boko Haram.
Security forces discover and dispose of unexploded bombs throughout the city. Authorities believe the explosives were planted by Boko Haram.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: JTF forces arrest a senior commander of Boko Haram, but decline to share his name. The arrest occurred at the home of the former governor of Borno State.
Participants in a governorship election enter a ballot distribution center to protest the poor distribution of materials to all polling places.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Eight people are killed after a Boko Haram attack, the third in as many days for the city. At least 30 dead over the course of the campaign, though the JTF say this number is inaccurate, asserting the number is closer to 13. The local hospital counts 23.
Residents discover the bodies of nine people they charge were killed by soldiers hunting suspects in a roadside bomb blast four days earlier.
Defusal: Police forces discover and successfully control-detonate an explosive hidden within the grounds of Gombe State University.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An explosive device targeting a military patrol went off on a road in Nigeria's northeastern city of Potiskum, setting the vehicle on fire. There were at least six soldiers on board the car, but their status is unclear. A nearby market was affected by the blast as well.
An IED explodes in a crowed market, causalities unknown.

Commercial cyclists popularly known as okada on Monday marched through some major streets in Lagos, protesting the state government's fresh clampdown and seizure of their bikes. Many attacked police officers and vandalized property.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The headmaster of Ari Primary School, Musa Magazai and one Mallam Galtamari, along with his two children, were killed in the early hours by gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect. The killings were perpetrated despite the 4pm-7am curfew imposed by Governor Ibrahim Gaidam last Monday.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, have burnt the house of a village head in Gwaje, Alhaji Mohammed Salisu Auwal, and killed two of his children. Witness: 'The gunmen ransacked my neighbours house, tied down the two kids, believed to be the biological sons of the village head inside the house and burnt them beyond recognition.'

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack the home of a man and set him ablaze.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, kill the son of a political figure.
A explosion, believed to be a bomb, injures two in rural Bauchi State.
Fulani militiamen attack a pub, kill four of the patrons and injuring seven others. It is not clear if this is a ethno-religious attack.

A suicide bomber rammed an SUV loaded with explosives into a Catholic church holding Mass on Sunday in northern Nigeria, killing at eight fifteen people and wounding 145 others. Some witnesses said the death toll could be as high as 12. They said the dead included children. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Christian youths retaliated against a group of Muslims following the blast, believing Boko Haram, or another Islamic group responsible. The death toll grew as the day wore on.

Following the attack on a Catholic church a group of Christian youths angrily assaulted several Muslims passing by the Church in an act of revenge. One individual is burned alive by the mob. Also, Muslim youths in their strongholds, of Tudun Wada, Rigassa and Kawo were said to have armed themselves in readiness for any possible reprisals from Christians.
Leaders communities in Akuku-Toru Local Government Area of Rivers State on protested against the alleged plan to cede oil wells in the council to neighboring Bayelsa State.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, invade a small town, torch a police station and a Christian/religious primary school. The attack began in the early evening, so it is not clear if civilians were present in the school. Causalities not reported.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, invade a small town, torch a police station and a primary school. Causalities not reported.

Protesting applicants in their hundreds stormed the Ministry of Interior in Abuja over what they described as the rejection of their applications for various paramilitary jobs. Security officials fired their side arms into the air to disperse the crowd.
Two policemen were killed by gunmen suspected to be ""cultists.""

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Harem gunmen shoot and kill the chairman of and ANPP and a prominent businessman near their residential neighbourhood.

Soldiers systematically shot and killed more than 40 civilians in the Kalari neighborhood, believing they had connections to Boko Haram. Dozens of men were forced from their homes in house to house searches in Maiduguri and marched to an open field where their faces were compared to photographic databases. Some were separated and then shot. Reports said 48 died, others 39, still others 70. In October, soldiers shot dead more than 30 civilians and burned homes in Maiduguri after a bomb suspected to have been planted by the sect killed a lieutenant. Following the attacks soldiers occupied the Kalari area of the city.
Unidentified gunmen kill four civilians and a security officer before they escaped. These gunmen are believed to be the same as those who attacked Jwol location.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a group of police on patrol, killing a corporal.
Victims displaced by a recent flood gathered to protest the governments poor handling of funds and materials donated to them.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen set fire to several government buildings and over 20 houses, three reported killed.
A retired Nigerian general, Mohammed Shuwa, is shot and killed, along with a guest at his home. The motive seems to be assassination. Boko Haram is suspected, but denies involvement.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a police officer in an attack. A suspect was later arrested.
Arrests: Police arrest 25 gunmen suspected of the killing of a police officer the previous day. It is unclear if any of the suspects had affiliations with Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram kill three outside a house. """"The three gunmen came on a motorcycle and opened fire on their victims who had just parked outside a house,"""" Kano state police spokesman Mustapha Abubakar told AFP.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attacked a police station, set fire to a primary school and destroyed several cell phone towers in the early morning hours. Witnesses saw the bodies of two police officers being carried out of the police station, though this was not substantiated.
A group of retired police officers gather to protest the non-payment of their pensions.
Motorcycle couriers clash with highway police, one dead.
Over 500 separatists who took part in the declaration of the Republic of Biafra on Monday have been arrested by the police. It is unclear if violence occurred between the actors.
Unknown gunmen attack and kill two soldiers along Potiskum-Maiduguri road.
Unknown insurgents invade a village, kill a family of four for unknown reasons.
A clash between police and okada riders causes nine injures.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Twin Boko Haram bomb blasts, targeting soldiers, kill two civilians.
Hundreds of ex-militants barricaded the only road into Yenagoa, the Bayelsa State capital, over the non-payment of their allowances over a period of six months.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The JTF raid a Boko Haram hideout, four insurgents are killed in a short clash.
Unknown armed men attack and kill three Fulani ethnic herders in an apparent act of revenge. The event occurred in a location known as Fadan Karshi.
Motorcycle couriers protest the police following the shooting of a colleague. Police respond with teargas.
Okada Riders attack a police station, torching five vehicles and seven motorcycles. It is not clear if the police responded.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An IED targeted at a group of JTF soldiers explodes, but causes no bodily harm. Following the explosion several gunshots were heard by witnesses.
Unidentified gunmen attack a group of riot police for unknown reasons.
Gunmen shot and killed two Chinese construction workers in rural Borno state, motive unknown.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a village head and his family. It is unclear if this is ethnic or political violence.
Labours protest the closure of a factory and the non-payment of salaries over the past six months.
Members of the Onitsha Market Traders' Association gathered at the Anambra State Government House in Awka to protest continuous molestation of them by the state's revenue agents.
Unidentified attackers throw a hand grenade into a cattle market in the mid-morning hours in Gambouru area.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and kills three police officers outside a police station in Yobe, break into the complex and steal weapons soon after.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following a police station attack, suspected Boko Haram attack and burn three churches, though they did not cause any causality.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram bomb a cattle market in the Gwange area, kill one.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspect Boko Haram gunmen raid a police station, kill one officer and wound another.

Gunmen have shot dead five Christian residents of a town in a restive northeastern Nigerian region previously hit by deadly Islamist attacks, however, the perpetrator is not known here, nor is it evident that victims were killed because they were Christians.
Unknown gunmen kidnap a journalists wife and two children at their home. It is unclear if the attack was motivated by ransom or politics.

No fewer than 15 persons were feared injured when supporters of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and Action Congress of Nigeria (ACN) on Monday, clashed in Gboko and Makurdi areas of Benue State. ACN members were holding a meeting at a hotel in Gboko when persons suspected to be PDP members, stormed the venue thus triggering the fight.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be of Boko Haram sect attacked Ummarari and Galadima wards of the metropolis, killing a University of Maiduguri (UNIMAID) don, Alhaji Babagana Kola and a director in the Ministry of Land and Survey Mallam Yerima.

Soldiers open fire on a group of rioters in Delta State. The rioters were attempting vigilante justice against a local whom they believed was a member of Boko Haram. 6 of the rioting group dead, many more injured. In a reprisal attack, irate villagers razed the palace of Ovie of Idjerhe, His Royal Majesty, Erhikevwe I, who, they suspected, invited the soldiers.
Unidentified ""thugs"" attack a group of protesting students, who were gathered to call for a government payment of tuition.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suspected Boko Haram member detonates a suicide car bomb near a church, claims eight lives plus injuries.

Unidentified gunmen killed the Director of Design and Construction in the Borno State Ministry of Water Resources, Mallam Ali Mohammed Sheriff in Maiduguri. This action appears to be an assassination.
Thousands of flood-displaced persons in relief camps in the Bayelsa capital, Yenagoa, on Thursday protested their eviction from the camps by the State Government.
Unidentified gunmen kill six members of the same family in the early morning hours.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces claim to have killed a high profile Boko Haram commander responsible for the assassination of a retired general on 2 November.
Unidentified gunmen launch an attack on JTF personnel. In retaliatory fire four of the gunmen were injured and subsequently arrested.
Seven are injured in a clash between supporters of AC and those of PDP. The clash began after a disagreement over the placement of their candidates political posters around the city.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill three traders in Maiduguri. The gunmen, according to an eyewitness and resident of Bulabulin ward, Chindo Ibrahim, stormed the traders' shops in a tricycle, chanting God is great and started firing gunshots into the air to scare people away from the area.
Unidentified gunmen launch an attack on a Zaria hotel.
Unidentified gunmen Saturday night killed a lawmaker, Ibrahim Abba Garko, of the ANPP, in the Unguwa Uku area of the city.

Unidentified gunmen on motorcycles shoot and kill a police officer and a bystander civilians for unknown reasons. It is believed the group of gunmen are the same group that attack a Zaria hotel the previous evening.

Following the killing of a Muslim by a Christian vigilante group, riots erupt, causing four initial deaths and property damage. The death toll later rose to 10. Police make over 50 arrests in following days.
On 18 November 2012, a Christian armed group killed a Muslim resident in Ibi (Ibi, Taraba) who insisted on going through their illegal checkpoint, triggering riots.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen shot and killed a Christian cleric in his home.

The former Chairman of Ikeja Local Government, Lagos State, and ex Special Adviser to Governor Babatunde Fashola on Health during his first term in office, Oluwatoyin Hamzat, was assassinated by unknown gunmen in the Sabo area of Shagama.

100 workers of Omala Local Government Area of Kogi State protested over unpaid salaries. According to an eyewitness, the workers stormed the council headquarters in Abejukolo at about 8. 00am, singing war songs and demanding the removal of a local council chairman.
A protesting labor union demonstrates outside the State House in Jos to demand back payment for seven months of salary.

A group of unnamed gunmen attacked a group of migrating Fulanis, killing 12, as well as 12 of their cattle. (The perpetrators are described as ""A group of notorious gunmen,"" but no names are provided.)
Members of the PDP and AC clash after AC attacks a PDP election office, burning it to the ground. Five reported injured.
A group of Christian women protest against the operation of nude hotels, sex hawking, and indecent dressing among others.
Students of University of Abuja on Monday protested the failure of the university management to meet up with the six months period given it to accredit some of its courses.
A Fulani herdsman rapes a newly wed Ketu (Yoruba) female.
A labor protest descends into riot when workers demanding payment storm the Plateau State House assembly, causing those inside to flee.

Five persons were reported killed and 15 houses set ablaze in the Obi Local Government Area of Nasarawa State in renewed clashes between Koro and Eggon tribesmen. The clash took place in the Gwadanye area of Agyaragu.
A group of 300 protest proposed maritime boundary demarcation among Cameroon and Nigeria in a border town.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill two persons in Shokwari Ward on the evening of 22 November.
Unidentified gunmen kill three villagers.

Four are killed in a riot of Islamic youths who had heard rumors of blasphemy against the prophet Muhammad from a local. A church and other shops were burned. This was revealed by eyewitnesses who told reporters in Kano, that the violence erupted as a result of a communication breakdown between a non-Muslim tailor and a Muslim man over an inscription on a dress designed by the tailor. Ten involved were later arrested.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill three persons in Polo Ward on the evening of 22 November.

Weapons Seizure: Chief of Army Staff Lieutenant General Azubuike Ihejirika publicly stated soldiers have seized weapons, huge sums of money and vehicles meant for suicide bombings over a period of time ""in the north-east."" Exact date(s) unknown. The announcement was made in Abuja.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Twenty females who wearing were wearing ""mini skirts"" were killed by unidentified, yet suspected to be Boko Haram militants in various locations throughout the city. The effected neighbourhoods of the city included Gwange, London Chiki, Abbagaram and Kaleri. The following that JTF authorities denied any such attacks took place.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A JTF team uncovers a bomb making factory in Mubi and makes one arrest of a Boko Haram leader.
Gunmen attacked the First Baptist Church in Sango Ota, Ogun State, killing two worshippers and injuring four others. The attackers took valuables from the victims before opening fire on them.
At least two people were feared killed while undetonated explosives were also discovered in a residence of a retired police officer in Gudum Sayawa, a suburb of Bauchi metropolis.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 11 people are killed and 30 injured after twin car bombs are detonated outside a military church (St. Andrew Military Protestant Church) within a barracks. Boko Haram has yet to claim responsibility, though authorities believe they are responsible. After 24 hours four more victims succumbed to their injuries. One report from United News of Bangladesh Limited has the death toll at 30.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack a family of Christians outside a church. Three deaths.

Unidentified gunmen abducted the former Vice Chancellor of Nnamdi Azikiwe University, Prof. Ilochi Okafor. The kidnapping may be political, as Prof. Okafor is a possible gubernatorial candidate in the next election cycle.

Unidentified men attack the Special Anti-Robbery Squad headquarters (SARS) in Abuja, freeing 150 +/- Boko Haram suspects held there. Initial reports have 10 deaths in the attack. Despite a large number of escaped prisons, Azeri Press reports a conflicting account with numbering five escaped in the attack.

Unidentified gunmen shot dead eight customers at a beer parlor in a traditionally Christian town. Others escaped with varying degrees of injury. Later or conflicting reports have the death count at 9 or 10.
Police forcibly eject a group of protesting students from a hostel, where they were demonstrating against the possible closure of university departments.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram raid the home of a ANPP head, killing he and another before escaping on motorcycles.

Movement of forces: Soldiers temporally ""take over a town"" after a group of robbers killed seven civilians during a bank job. Traffic disrupted. It was later learned the perpetrators were members of Boko Haram.

Villagers from Hiepang and other communities in Barkin Ladi Local Government Area of Plateau State yesterday barricaded the Jos-Abuja Road to protest the killing of 10 people in a beer garden earlier in the week.

The Agbere community, Sagbama Local Government Area, Bayelsa State, was in disarray on Tuesday after youths went on the rampage, burning houses and destroying property in the area over a chieftaincy dispute. Twelve youths died in the incident.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian military authority said one soldier died during an exchange of fire with Boko Haram while three of the sect were shot dead. Following the fighting the military was able to recover a large cache of the sects arms, as well as make arrests.
Gunmen open fire from a moving automobile near the local airport, kill ten.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, likely Boko Haram, attack a police outpost, kill five officers and destroy telecom antennas. The attackers also carted away some arms from police armoury.
Weapons Seizure: Security forces uncover a weapons cache buried in a hideout in Kandahar area of Damaturu.
Three are dead after unidentified gunmen attack a village.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram (not confirmed) commits a bank robbery, attacks two police stations, guns down seven civilians.
People of Oruku and Umuode communities clash, destroying several houses in the process. It is unclear what set began the violence. Causalities unreported.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Weapons Seizure: Security forces uncover a Boko Haram weapons cache during a raid in the Jushin Ciki neighbourhood.
Ethnic Ilaje settlers and residents of a neighborhood clash. One dead, fifteen houses destroyed.
Factions of the PDP clash over political appointees.
Unidentified gunmen attack a patrol of JTF soldiers south of Jos. One dead in the fighting.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least two Baptist pastors have been ""recently"" killed and a number of Baptist properties destroyed in violent attacks by Boko Haram in Jaji. Exact date(s) unknown.
Gunmen attack a immigration office, kill two officers and a bystander. Later, a bakery was attacked, killing three workers. It is unclear if this was a militant attack or a robbery.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack a police divisional headquarters in Damask. Causalities unknown.
Security operatives uncover and raid a bomb factory.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of the Islamist group Boko Haram killed 10 Christians by slitting their throats in the northern Nigerian town of Chibok late in the day, local officials said. It is believed this group of perpetrators are the same as those involved in an attack on a Nigeria-Cameroon border crossing.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military and police forces kill a top Boko Haram commander, Abdulkareem Ibrahim and two of his sub commanders in a raid.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack a police divisional headquarters, killing two officers.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: JTF forces uncover a large Boko Haram bomb factory, recover arms.
Residents report: ""there was a very heavy explosion this morning that shook the entire city,"" but they or authorities could provide more details.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram burnt down a police headquarters and three churches in a border town with Cameroon. Two dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram burnt down a police headquarters and three churches in a border town with Cameroon. Two dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen on motorcycles, numbering about fifty, attacked and burned three churches and a divisional police headquarters in Kano.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen launch a second attack in three days on Damasak, kill five residents.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen on motorcycles, numbering about fifty, attacked and burned three churches and a divisional police headquarters in Kano, killing a police officer.
Unknown gunmen yesterday killed two persons in a fierce gun battle with security men in Azare town of Bauchi. Another report has the death total at 6.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following a battle between Boko Haram and the JTF and the apparent assassination of a ANPP leader, two classroom teachers are killed by suspected Boko Haram when the group attacked a nearby school.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack a military base, killing a police officer and a bystander civilian.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attacked the residence of an Islamic cleric, shoot and kill him.
Two persons were confirmed dead when hoodlums suspected to be militants attacked Naval officers at an outpost located at the outskirt of the city of Onitsha.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following a battle between Boko Haram and the JTF, a leader of and ANPP is shot and killed in his area residence by a suspected member of the militant organization.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Eleven are killed when suspected Boko Haram clashed with a JTF squad. Other arrested. (Details in the sources account for the death of two, but do not give specifics to the remaining nine.)
Three persons, including a traffic warden, were critically injured in an early morning bomb blast at Kantin Kwari junction, near the Eid praying ground in the Fagge section of the city.
Action Congress party members took to the streets in protest against the tenure elongation of the interim council chairmen in the 33 local councils of the state.

A large group of youths storm an oil terminal operated by the Nigerian Agip Oil Company in the area and shut down production in the facility. The protesters were said to be angry over a report that the oil company had begun implementation of the GMoU it entered with Okpoama community.

The wife of a lawmaker in Ogun State, Mrs. Folashade Onademuren, was abducted by gunmen at a construction site on Lewu street, Obalende area of Ijebu-Ode. It is unknown if this action is political or for monastery gain.
Passengers of a bus survived a bomb attack against them. The blast occurred near Malam Aminu Kano Teaching Hospital, coming one day after a similar attack against civilians elsewhere in the city.
Gunmen enter a prominent lawyers home, shoot and kill him for unknown reasons.
Hours after a bomb targeting a bus exploded, attackers shot and killed two police officers directing traffic in the same area.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A bystander is killed in a shootout between Boko Haram and security forces near Ibrahim Taiwo police station along Baga road.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four Boko Haram chiefs are killed, two soldiers are injured in various raids over three days (December 3rd, 4th and 5th) in Maiduguri. Area effected include Sabon Gere, Sabon Layin Gwange, Dala Sajeri, Biafra and Suleimanti areas of the city.
Scores of women marched round major streets of Ibadan calling on legislators to make laws on violence against women.
Communal and ethnic militias clash in a Lagos suburb over the over the control and collection of tolls in the area. Five killed.
An explosive is detonated near Filin police station in Kano. Following the explosion where was reported sporadic gunfire. At least two civilian passersby wounded.
Unidentified attackers throw a hand grenade at a police vehicle in the """"outskirts of Kano."""" Following the blast police arrest several of their attackers. No reported death or injury.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Five police officers are injured when an explosive planted in their vehicle detonates near Hotoro Eastern bypass. Following the explosion police officers arrested eight of the attackers, who are believed to be in or affiliated with Boko Haram. The event occurred at 7:20am along Ring Road.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A man suspected to be involved with Boko Haram shot and killed a blind resident of the Zajiri Ward of the city.
Five people were injured and property destroyed in an attack on Unguwar Mai-Yasin village in Danja Local Government Area of Katsina State by unknown persons.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A school teacher and two others were yesterday murdered by gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members. The gunmen, according to a resident, sneaked into the residence of the school teacher, who worked a private school in the area.
Weapons Seizure: The JTF recovered at least 11 rifles during a security raid, though no mention from whom.
Unidentified persons abducted the mother of the Minister of Finance, Dr. Ngozi Okonjo Iweala, at her Ogwashi-Uku, Delta State residence. It is not clear if the abduction is politically motivated.
Government House security attack a journalist outside the Akwa Ibom State House.
Protesters gather to demonstrate against a newly adopted state government tax policy.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram members have killed a District Head of Dusuma Ward of Jere Local Government Area of Borno State, Kazalla Ali, and his son, after a late night attack on their home.

Members of the Traders Association of Aguiyi Ironsi Complex, Ladipo, in Mushin, Lagos State on Monday, protested against the continued detention of their president, Jonathan Okoli, over allegation of attempted murder, claiming the polices investigative techniques were unethical. The protest took place on the premises of Igbosere High court, Lagos.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Fourteen persons, including a Divisional Police Officer (DPO) were killed in Potiskum during a crossfire between members of the Boko Haram sect and security officials. Three of the deceased are civilians who caught in the crossfire. An unconfirmed report also has it that the suspected militants made attempt to attack the palace of the Emir of Fika within the town, Alhaji Mohammed Idrissa Ibn Abale, but were repelled by men of the Joint Task Force (JTF) stationed in the palace. At attack began at 2 am with the bombing of a police station.
Soldiers in Kaduna State shot and killed a tanker driver for alleged improper parking.
A group of labours gather for a pro-government protest in hopes of raising the state minimum wage.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram armed men attacked the Government Girls Secondary School, Bama, killing five students and injuring three others.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two women in a market for unknown reasons. No arrests made following the incident.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect yesterday ambushed some soldiers guarding a telecommunication mast and a primary school along Chezcon area in the Bolori ward of the Maiduguri metro. One soldier killed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attacked and killed a retired soldier. The former soldier, Mohmmed Bulama, was followed by two gunmen then shot in his residence at Ruwan Zafi ward of the metropolis.
Gunmen shot and killed Danladi Isa Kademi (ANPP), a member representing Gaya in the Kano state House of Assembly. The gunmen were suspected to be hired assassins.
On 14 June 2012, unidentified gunmen clashed with and killed 10 members of a local armed group near Zurmi (Zurmi, Zamfara).
Suspected Fulani militia attack and kill a man and his four children. It is unclear if the attack was motivated by ethnicity.
Two factions of the AC (unnamed) brawl at a voting drive.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen stormed into a Maiduguri market, shot and killed and trader, wounded two others.
State police shut down a labour protest with tear gas. Ten report injury. Some witnesses report the firing of live ammunition by the police.
Police break up a NLC protest after the group gathered for a three day labour strike.

Gunmen have bombed and attacked a police station and kidnapped a Frenchman, Mr Francis Colump in Rimi Local Government area of Katsina State. A Boko Haram splinter group, Ansaru, later claims responsibility. Two reported deaths.

Two groups loyal to different wings of the PDP clash. Both factions fought over which group will control the party secretariat located along Presidential Boulevard, Abeokuta. Of the groups clashing one was loyal to President Olusegun Obasanjo, and the other, state former Governor Gbenga Daniel.
Youths of St. Dominic Catholic Parish, in Awgu Local Government Area, protested against the alleged intimidation of their Parish Priest by police, who were investigating him for a police case.
Fulani militias invade a village and kill a local farmer who was said to have prevented their cattle from grazing in his farmland.

Two suicide car bombers attacked the facilities of two mobile phone operators in Kano, killing themselves and maiming at least one person. The attack on the Airtel office, located opposite Malam Kato Square military cenotaph and overlooking Central Bank office in the state, occurred around 8:45am. Less than one hour after the first blast, another explosion went off at an MTN switch station opposite Northern Flour Mills along Maimalari Road in Bompai industrial area, about 500 metres from the state police command, killing only the bomber. Authorities did not speculate as to the identity or group affiliation of the perpetrators, though Boko Haram have demonstrated similar behaviour in the area.

Gunmen, insinuated to be Boko Haram, though possibly related to MEND, attacked a vessel 40km of the coast of Bayelsa in the Delta region and kidnapped four private foreign sailors. Motivation unknown.
A bomb detonates near a pub in the Badawa quarters of Kano. There were no causalities.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Fourteen members of Boko Haram and one police officer are shot and killed in a shootout after the sect attempted to rob a bank. Four Boko Haram corpses were recovered by police, while the other ten were carried away by the sect to conceal their identities.
An unknown gunman shot and killed three persons and injured fived others in a unprovoked attack.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, believed to be Boko Haram, opened fire on a Baptist Church during Christmas service, killing six church members.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, believed to be Boko Haram, opened fire on a Catholic church during a crowded Christmas service, killing six including the pastor.

Unknown gunmen reportedly shot and killed the chairman of a local government of Kano State in the Karkasara area of Kano City, though this was not confirmed by authorities, nor was the councilmans name.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces raid a Boko Haram bomb factory, kill five suspected members.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill prominent businessman for reasons unknown.
Unidentified gunmen enter a small village and kill three residents.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram kill five civilians around 1am. Some were shot, while others were ""killed."" Some reports claim fifteen were killed in the attack.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack and kill a blind resident of the Zajiri Ward of the city. His son was injured in the attack. The reason for the attack is unknown.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian Army killed five and injured two suspected members of Boko Haram, following a shootout between the two groups in Kaduna. The Army operation, which lasted about five hours, took place at Namadi Road in Rigasa district of Igabi Local Government Area (LGA) in Kaduna metropolis when the men of the Nigerian Army stormed a bomb making factory in the area following a tip-off.
Unidentified gunmen kill six people in Riyom. Details of the attack are unknown.
A retired soldier is killed at his home by suspected Fulani herdsmen.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram enters a village between 1 and 3am, executes five persons in their houses. Other reports have the death figure at 15.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following an attack on a military base, suspected Boko Haram militants attacked a primary school in the Bolari Ward of Maiduguri city. No causalities reported.

A group of 40 unidentified gunmen entered a border town near Cameroon in the early morning hours and began attacking the local police station and other government buildings. At least 30 dead. Many residents believe Boko Haram was responsible, though the town does have a history of attacks by armed thieves and street gangs.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, believed to be of Boko Haram, attacked a military post containing telecom masts, an often sought target. One soldier reported dead due to the attack. Following the attack on the military base the same suspected group attacked a primary school in the area.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Militants, believed to be Boko Haram, attacked a village, targeting its civilian residents and a divisional police headquarters, freeing 35 inmates held in its prison. Twenty deaths, injuries unknown.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Members of the National Union of Road Transport Workers clash over internal politics. The violence began after It was learnt that a faction of union invaded the state secretariat of the union on Ado Road and attempted to sack the State Executive Committee led by Obayoriade Olajutele. The warring faction of the NURTW had reportedly attempted to seize control of some motor-parks. As a result, the fight spread to the major streets including the popular Oba-Adesida Road, causing residents to flee. Causalities unknown.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces shoot and kill four members of Boko Haram in a clash, one police officer reported dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a crowed Sunday church service, kills 15. Boko Haram had attacked the same town less than a month earlier.
Two are killed and 1,500 are displaced following a Gwari/Igbo clash with Fulanis. The motivation for the violence appears to be the control of grazing land.

Hundreds of residents of Obasanjo Estate, Ikere Ekiti, Ekiti State, protested against the alleged health hazards of the operations of the Inland Quarry Stone at the back of the estate. The protesters blocked a section of the Ado Ekiti-Ikere Ekiti road, disrupting vehicular movements.

Youths and police clashed in Kuru, near Jos, following the killing of one youth on Sunday night by a stray bullet. The youths took the streets in protest of the killing by setting large fires in the streets and throwing rocks at traffic. Intervention by police led to violent clashes, seven reported dead.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: One soldier and 13 Boko Haram insurgents are killed during a gun duel at Bulabulin and Bayan Quarters areas of Maiduguri. Residents said they heard sounds of gunfire between 4pm and 6pm in the two locations.

Former chairmen and councillors of Imo, recently fired by incoming Governor Rochas Okorocha, protest throughout the streets of Owerri. They assembled under the name ""Association of Local Governments of Nigeria.""

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attacked the Nigerian Prison Service (NPS) Farm Centre, Maiduguri, with improvised explosive devices (IED) and petrol-bombs at about 12pm on Thursday, freeing several inmates from detention. The farm centre, which is used for farming and reformation of inmates by NPS, is located on Maiduguri-Gamboru/Ngala Road in the outskirt of the state's capital. No reported causalities.
A group of 100 or more unidentified gunmen attacked a village, including its police station. A soldier and a police officer killed. Two civilians were also targeted in the attack.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least seven security operatives and five Boko Haram gunmen were killed in Marte Local Government Area of Borno State when some gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram ambushed troops deployed in the area to maintain peace and order. The ensuing gunfight lasted an hour.
A group of 100 or more unidentified gunmen attacked a village, including its police station. Among the targets were a child and his grandmother.

A group of Fulani attack three villages in Birnin Magaji LGA, kill seven and wound others. The first of the villages, Makera, was attacked at dawn, causing three causalities at a mosque, plus wounded. Following the attack at Makera the Fulanis left for Usu, at town 100km away, and caused four more deaths in their attack there. The third attacked village, Azuko, recorded no causalities. Authorities believe the attacks were motivated by revenge.
Property destruction: Unknown person(s) set seven car alight outside a local government office.

A group of Fulani attack three villages in Birnin Magaji LGA, kill seven and wound others. The first of the villages, Makera, was attacked at dawn, causing three causalities at a mosque, plus wounded. Following the attack at Makera the Fulanis left for Usu, at town 100km away, and caused four more deaths in their attack there. The third attacked village, Azuko, recorded no causalities. Authorities believe the attacks were motivated by revenge.

A group of Fulani attack three villages in Birnin Magaji LGA, kill seven and wound others. The first of the villages, Makera, was attacked at dawn, causing three causalities at a mosque, plus wounded. Following the attack at Makera the Fulanis left for Usu, at town 100km away, and caused four more deaths in their attack there. The third attacked village, Azuko, recorded no causalities. Authorities believe the attacks were motivated by revenge.

column7: G-11: Group of 11 Opposition Parties to Patasse
column17: The G-11 group marked the one year anniversary of their protest against the NLC with an anniversary protest.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill two Fulani herdsmen, who were armed at the time of their deaths.

A JTF raid to capture Boko Haram kingpin Ali Jalingo (actor not confirmed) sparks gunfire outside his home. Many residents in the area flee their homes for fear of reprisal attacks. It is unclear if the raid was successful

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram kill a police officer during a security raid.

Unidentified gunmen shot three persons dead at the Tudun Maliki area of Kano. The gunmen, who shot sporadically, sacred many residents into a nearby mosque. Police and military forces were deployed to the area.

Joint Task Force (JTF) operatives killed three people and destroyed three houses during an early morning raid in Chikaji and Kwantareshen area of the city. Witnesses said the operatives stormed the Tudun Muntsari area of Chikaji in Sabon Gari, Zaria and opened fire sporadically. There is no word at to who these people were, or why they were targeted.
Fulani gunmen (suspected) attack the home town of state governor Jonah Jang, two dead. It is unclear if the attack was related to his residency. Police later arrest suspects.
Unidentified gunmen on motorbikes shot and killed the former police orderly to the Governor. It is unclear if the killing was related to his former political appointment.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two police and injured two civilians at Tishama Kawo quarters in the outskirt of Kano.
Assassins shoot and kill the Editor of a newspaper, Anambra News, Mr. IK Udendu for unknown reasons.
A security team kills two armed ""youths"" at Tudun Amba along Doma road in Lafia Local Government Area.
No fewer than seven are killed in a clash between the people of Adadama and those of a nearby town over the course of two days. The violence was brought on by a disagreement over the use of land.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four police and killed by suspected Boko Haram, who ambushed them while on patrol at Yanawaki area of Unguwa Uku on the outskirts of Kano metropolis.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces arrest a Boko Haram commander, Mohammed Zangina, following a raid. Mohammed Zangina is suspected of being behind the bombing of two newspaper offices in Abuja and Kaduna last April.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen ambushed military patrol with an IED, resulting in the death of one soldier. According to JTF sources in Yobe State, gunmen came on four motorcycles to ambush the patrol vehicles at a food canteen.
No fewer than seven are killed in a clash between the people of Adadama and those of a nearby town over the course of two days. The violence was brought on by a disagreement over the use of land.

Unidentified persons shot and killed four, while injuring two others in a location known as Fang. ""Pandemonium"" broke out in Riyom local council area of Plateau State Tuesday following the killings.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces arrest Boko Haram commander known as Salisu Mohammed after a short gun battle in which he was wounded.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram opened fire on a police patrol in the Yanawaki area, two causalities. The gunmen were able to escape following the incident.

Security forces shoot and kill two gunmen (not identified) and arrest five others in Kano State after they repelled an attack by """"militants"""" on a checkpoint near Danladi Nasidi quarters along Maiduguir Road.

A group of 50 armed men of Amagu, Ebonyi entered Adadama, killed ten farmers, beheading two. The group also kidnapped Mr James Ekoro, the secretary of the Adadama Traditional Rulers, destroyed the local police station and stole office furniture. The motivation for the attack is unknown, but may be related to a clash in the town earlier in the week.
Unidentified gunmen, likely Boko Haram, attacks two police officers, kill one, as well as a civilian girl who was nearby.
Three are dead, including one civilian, when military forces raid a ""militant"" hideout in Gombe. Name of the organization was not known.
Gunmen attack an over-the-road bus in rural Kogi State, kill two soldiers, injure five others. It is not clear if the soldiers were the gunmens specific target.

Two soldiers are killed and five others wounded in Okene city when the group was targeted with an IED explosion. The soldiers were part of a contingent due to be deployed to Mali. Ansaru claimed responsibility for the attack in the following days.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect launched an attack at a mechanical workshop in Bulunkutu area of Maiduguri where they killed a resident who took his car in for repairs. Specific motivation unknown.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, believed to be Boko Haram, attacked the Emir of Kano, Alhaji Ado Bayero, killing his driver and three personal guards. Security forces later arrested suspects.
2,000 youths took to the streets of Owerri, the Imo State capital yesterday to protest the rising wave of violence in the area. The group blamed the police for not ""doing enough"".

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram attacked a trading post, killed 18 hunters selling meat. It is believed they were attacked for selling monkeys and pigs, both forbidden in Islam.

Thousands of Igbo traders at Mission Road protested to the state Government House calling for the removal of Maj.Lawrence Loye, over what they described as unwarranted recent closure of their shops in the area.
Agreement: A peace meeting is held between Fulani and Tarok factions in Wase local government area.
Food traders protest the Governor Babatunde Fashola after forced closure of their stands in Balogun Market.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram attacked and killed five civilians outside a drinking establishment.
Clash between two ethnic militias at a location known as Aladura. Causalities unknown.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram sect members killed three persons and injured a soldier in the Jiddari-Polo area of the metropolis, following a shootout that lasted 30 minutes.

The home of a Fulani man is attacked at Du district of Jos South Local Government Area, at about 9.15 pm. One person was said to have been killed, while another was injured. It is unclear if the perpetrators specifically targeted the mans home because he was a Fulani, or if the attack was simply coincidental.

At least 10 people have been killed in a communal clash in Wadata between Fulanis and Taroks. The violence comes three days after a peace meeting between the two groups. Other reports have the death total at 20.
A IED explodes, targeting military personnel. A gun battle follows, lasting more than an hour. An estimated four dead.
Gunmen invaded the homes of five victims at 3 am, held them at gunpoint, slit their throats.
One person was gunned down by two gunmen who invaded London Ciki Ward at about 10.30am, firing several shots into the air before heading to the house of the victim where they shot him at close range.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen, suspected to be Boko Haram, attacked the community of Tasha Ngwa and shot dead a former state commander of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA).

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces exchange fire with suspected members of Boko Haram, two dead, including a civilian.
A ethnically driven clash claims three lives and causes over 500 to be displaced. The clash was sparked by an apparent misunderstanding or accident.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Eight persons, including a deputy treasurer of a local government area in Borno State, were in the early hours of the day killed by Boko Haram gunmen.
